I've seen better Harems and RomComs than this.


Overall: 4/10


Overall, this anime plays on tropes and cliches that have been done before and better. I seriously gave this anime a second chance to see if maybe I'm being too critical but I still don't like it. 


The non-existent originality in this story killed my enjoyment and 

the romance in this story is pathetic.

(Just to be extra edgy: Fuck Nisekoi and it should go die in a hole.).

Favorite Quote: "I may just be your fake boyfriend, but if anything happens I'll be the one to protect you." -Raku Ichijou
Nisekoi or should I say False Love in the English translation. I originally done a review on this romantic comedy on my old account, son714, but I lost the account information.  Anyways, I've always connected alot more with the kind and caring characters in romantic comedies. Actually to be honest, I've always done this in almost every anime. I guess one could say I'm a very kind person. Hence, the reason why I identify with that specific quote from Nisekoi and as someonewho has personally done this as well.  So how do I feel about Nisekoi? Here's the my review of why I really enjoyed it.


Story: As the summary suggests it's about two gang families who attempt to stop the ongoing conflict by faking a relationship between two of our main characters. Simple right? Actually, not quite. The story adds a rather interesting twist to it with the key locket and the promise that the main character kept in his childhood years. I thought that this would make the storyline rather overwhelming, but surprisingly, it wasn't. I felt that the overall plot was still retained after introducing the fake relationship between Raku and Chitoge. However, one thing to note is that the romance in this series didn't offer us anything new. It was a generic all girls like the guy type harem. But what I did like was the approach they took to develop this. Instead of using a simple high school setup, the author used the gang family conflict and the locket as a way to develop the romance. It wasn't painfully obvious like other romantic comedies. It had me second guessing alot at times.

9/10


Art: The art in Nisekoi was actually very well done. Some parts are just so colorful and lively, but despite that, it didn't distract me from the overall story.

10/10


Sound: I loved the soundtrack and the opening alot. The soundtrack perfectly captured the mood of many parts of the segment. For example, there are times when Raku had to go save Chitoge countless times. The soundtrack goes from being comical to being serious. It helps build tension and the romance.

10/10


Character: The characters in this series was also very well done. As I watched the series the anime does a good job of introducing new characters. They did it in a way where it had me constantly wonder whether or not this will effect Raku's fake relationship with Chitoge. One other thing that I liked about the characters was how they developed over time. This was especially true for Raku and Chitoge. As dense as the main character is, the fake relationship with Chitoge actually made him question who he liked. We also see him show his true character towards the people around him.  Gradually however, he began to realize his feelings which shows character development.  I thought that was pretty cool. Other than that, the character didn't offer us anything new in the romantic comedy genre.

9/10


My Opinion: Honestly, Nisekoi is the my second favorite harem and romantic comedy. It is also one of my favorite animes of all time. I understand opinions may differ, but I think everything that we would expect from a romantic comedy is here. Not only that, it was hilarious and serious at times.  The writing was done extremely well to convey this to the audience. It sure hooked me in and wanted me to continue the series. So much that I was continuing the manga. But there are times when it fell short from being a masterpiece. The characters would be something you would expect from a harem series. If there was a 9.5 rating I would definitely give it that. Loved the anime and hope to see more of from this anime.


Thank you for reading my review. I hope this persuaded you guys to check out this anime. You will get tons of laughs, I promise that! A great anime that is worth a watch.


Final Score: 9/10

Nisekoi, came for the soundtrack left for the poor character development and plot points. Did you like Oreimo? Maybe not so much because of the incest? Well welcome to oreimo minus incest. Where the best girl wars are so fierce you can't help but laugh at the idiocy of it all. This series is basically a combination of Oreimo and Golden time (though instead of ghosts no one can remember what the hell happened 10 years ago as if that somehow makes a cohesive plot). The story is awful, you know the ship from the start. You also know exactly how it's going to playout with the dopey main character doing exactly what protaganistkun should (winning all the time ayup).


That being said it's a cute show if you can get past the fact that it's been blatantly ripping off its own genre (much like MHA and shounen). It does combine the elements well it's just not especially interesting because of it's lack of originality though.


It gets +3 for 2 OPs by ClariS though. That's about the only redeeming thing about this show.

TL;DR:
A high school boy, the heir of a yakuza gang, is forced into a relationship with a girl from another gang, when his heart is actually set on finding his dream girl; a girl he made a promise to 10 years ago but whose identity he no longer remembers. The story had so much potential, but the circular plot that resolved nothing in the end, became a disappointment. The question, "who was the girl 10 years ago" was never answered, and it dragged on too long it kinda makes anyone lose interest in actually finding out the answer in the second season.
I would say, thisAnime is good enough to make you enjoy it till the end, but not so much that you would consider continuing with season 2.


Music, Art and Voice acting isn't really a problem. It was well executed, but not overwhelmingly good that it merits an Oscar Award.



STORY - 7/10


I must say, anyone, including me, would have really high hopes considering the unique concept of the story. The premise of a fake and forced relationship due to gang wars definitely might sound original and cool, but I must say, the story fell a little bit short and didn't deliver to it's full potential.


Anyone would want to know who the mystery girl 10 years ago is, and its fun to see that her identity isn't too straightforward. However, as the producers wanted to make the mystery complex, it ended up involving too many people and the confusion just ends up losing the interest of any watcher. It's fine to have 2 potential girls who could be the mystery girl, but to suddenly and abruptly introduce another girl in the middle of the series (and reveals that this new girl is also potentially the one), it became very messy and cluttered. Not to mention, it became unrealistic. A coincidence could happen twice, but three times? That's too much of a stretch for anyone.


The aren't any fillers or plot holes that were obvious to the average viewer, however, the plot was very circular because what you knew as you started the series, remains the same even when you end the series.  


ART - 8/10


Not much to talk about here. I know that art is subjective and it depends on your preference, however, I will generally describe the artistic value of this piece as neutral as I may.


The characters are drawn well enough to draw out emotions and feelings from the viewers. For example, the girls in the Anime are drawn good enough for anyone to believe that this is what a 'beautiful' girl looks like.


The animation panels were consistence and the style didn't seem to deviate as the series progressed. The fluidity of each passing scene felt natural and worked well in telling the story.


The colours in the Anime are also not a problem. There were no blinding colours as observed in some bad Animation out there, (ahem, Pokemon) but were vibrant enough to keep the story alive, cheerful happy. This tone suits the story and didn't feel unnecessarily forced.


The backgrounds were to a certain extent good, but definitely not special. Not something worth remembering, and certainly doesn't make you pause the video and say, "wow". It's not bad though, I must say, as the backgrounds didn't interfere with the telling of the story.


One unique point of discussion in this Anime is the flashbacks. The flashbacks are made to look like a playback on a 1960's black and white film. I had no problem with this, in fact, I kinda liked it as it made it obvious that this unclear film was a depiction of the main protagonist's poor memory over the events that unfolded 10 years ago.


SOUND - 8/10


First, let's talk about the opening themes. All three were in my opinion, perfectly suited to the tone of the story. The cheerful, fast paced melody is in a way a metaphor to show the cheerful, ever-so-happy attitude of high school kids and the innocence of love. The opening themes might not land in everyone's Itunes playlists, but if you hear it, even once, you would already be able to guess what the story is about.


Second, the closing. This is a bit more interesting as the tone is not just cheerful, but it is to a certain extent, kawaii. This kawaii melody compliments the cheerful and playful attitude of the story and doesn't make you forget what you are currently watching.


Finally, the voice acting. BEAR IN MIND, I WATCHED THE ANIME IN JAPANESE AUDIO. The Japanese voice actors fit into their roles very well. In fact, the tones they had were appropriate to how their characters were portrayed in the series, so much so that you can easily tell apart who's voice belong to who even if the screen went black. Never in the series did the voice acting sound unusual, unnatural and forced. Not once. Kudos to the voice actors.


CHARACTERS - 6/10


Here's where I had a problem. The character development. In any Animation series, we want ALL the major characters to grow as a person and reveal who they are as a person naturally, without forcing it. This means, we would like to observe how a character behaves, not be told how they behave. The development of some characters were severely lacking, and it was obvious too. I know that in any Harem, it's hard to balance the screentime of every girl, however, if the series were to introduce a major and important character so late into the series, and not bother to develop that character, they might as well not introduce the character at all. What's the point of having such an important character be unnaturally forced to fit into a plot if it just clutters everything and ruins the character as a person?


This asymmetry of influence that each protagonist have resulted in unbalanced development. Often we had seen too much of one character and at the same time, we saw too little of another character. The relationships between the characters felt alien and illogical as a result. This made the love dispute unbelievable and sound corny.


ENJOYMENT - 8/10


Despite having some major setbacks in terms of character development, the concept of the story was already fundamentally strong, strong enough to support the interest of any watcher to continue watching till the end. It didn't necessarily become boring or repetitious at any point although it might have become quite confusing near the end. The presence of some fan service as well as drama is enough to draw the attention of any average anime fan, and the mystery was compulsive enough to make us stay curious throughout 75% of the whole series. 


All in all, the Anime was good but could have been better. Worth a watch but not worth a rewatch.


Fake Love? Doesn't look Fake to me.

Nisekoi makes me question what it really is that separates a good anime, from a bad one. Objectively speaking, there are various criteria one uses to justify the aforementioned verdict; standard criteria such as Art, Story, and so on. However, Nisekoi is the perfect example of how it is possible to enjoy something that isn't really all that original, or amazing, or groundbreaking. Perhaps the best thing about Nisekoi is that it is just... enjoyable to watch, somehow. You could take a pen to paper and put down all of it's shortcomings, but this isn't a show that makes you want to do that.
Now whyshould one watch Nisekoi? if you're looking for some lighthearted comedy with extremely cute girls, this should probably be first on your list. There's nothing spectacular about the plot, which actually starts off kind of interesting, but meanders around and goes nowhere really. It reverts back to the status quo which was set at episode 1 so frequently that if you're interested to see where this "romance" that's frequently advertised leads, you will be rather disappointed. However, that's not to say that this show isn't entertaining. And there are a few reasons why it is. 


Eye-popping is what I'd call Nisekoi. I've always found Shaft to have a very unique and personalized approach towards making anime and Nisekoi doesn't receive any less effort in that regard. The art of this show is simply gorgeous whilst staying true to the source material by Naoshi Komi (which was great to begin with when compared to regular manga), and might I even go so far as to say that it enhances it. Scenes are drawn well, there is interesting camera work that goes on, and this show is just really colorful and easy on the eye. If you want evidence for the above, just watch Nisekoi's opening track "CLICK" by ClaRIS and you will know what I'm talking about. There's so much interesting art work going on in that OP itself that advertises this show's beautiful visuals. I'm frankly in love with that OP and I've never once skipped it.


The sound of Nisekoi is also pretty darn good. I rarely go so far as to collect a show's soundtrack, but I enjoyed almost every track on this one's OST. Each girl has their own little theme song which reflects their personality rather well, and they're all very refreshing to hear.


From a technical standpoint, Nisekoi is very, very well done, and I can only wish that other far superior shows in terms of plot substance had received such treatment. As a viewer, you will enjoy what this show has to offer in this regard. However, be prepared to deal with the rather shallow, non-progressive plot in favor of everyday comedic interactions. Also, there's a decent amount of fanservice going on but nothing too overboard.


Watch and enjoy Nisekoi for the cute girls, the art, and the music. Plot annoyances aside, and the fact that this is one of those harems where all the girls love the main character for little to no reason, I think Nisekoi is worth a shot if you're looking for lighthearted comedy once in a while. I'll give this a 7.5/10, rounded down to a 7.

So basically, my thoughts on the series should wait until I see season 2, but think of this as a checkpoint. But from what I've seen in season 1, it has a personable artstyle, the music is good, production quality is top notch. My main issue goes to everything that's wrong with cliche high school anime, in how the main character has a selection of girls to choose from, but ends up doing nothing in the end, oh goodie. BUT, what I do like is that you see the conflictions that Raku goes through, he likes Onodera, but over time starts to take aliking to Chitoge. That's something that's realistic and I could see that happening. I also didn't get the usual "He's a total dumbass" going through my head as often as other series (believe me though, he does do some pretty fucking stupid things). Even with that, his inability to take confidence in himself as well as read Chitoge's feelings bogs down Raku into my category of "alright" protagonists. Not unbearable, but not great either. I'd put him on the same level as Kodaka from season 2 of Haganai, where it's a slightly more fleshed out protagonist that doesn't quite escape the grips of average-ness. Onodera is pretty much the "Oh I like Raku, but I'm too shy to confess my feelings". Nothing much more than that. It's even more infuriating that Raku also likes her but he does nothing as well. Chitoge is essentially Kirino with no eroge playing. Like, that was the exact vibe I got from her. A more stark comparison would be Azusa from Henneko. Still, that makes Chitoge one of the more interesting characters in the show, and thank Sonic 3(my version of God) the series is aware of that because she gets the most screen time out of every girl. Marika sort of shows up near the end, you expect something to happen with her, but nothing does, I guess until season 2. She brings along with her a major rift in the plot, but nothing was ever done with it here. The supporting cast is also generic. Perverted best friend, short girl with glasses that shows little emotion, etc. The comedy is also alright. What Nisekoi does well is create a great setup, and the way things play out is generic, but it's not offensive. It was a decent watch, but probably something that's not going to stick with me after finishing the series. I'd recommend giving it a watch if you're bored and want one of the better high school animes.

Story 8/10: 
The story of Nisekoi is a very good idea and i quite enjoyed it.  It was Original and fresh.
Art 7/10:
I also enjoyed the art quite a bit. I personally liked how all the characters looked even Chitoge.
Sound 6/10:
The sound was OK in my opinion i did not like nor dislike the music.
Characters 6/10:
In my opinion all of the characters are great except Chitoge.  Onodera and Tsugumi are quite likeable characters.
Enjoyment 1/10:
Even though i enjoyed the shyness of Onodera, Chitoge literally ruined this series for me.
Overall 3/10:
Even though Nisekoi has strong points like the art, story and a few characters, Chitoge literallyruins it all. I just could not keep watching it.
The story was good and gave me hope but the ending was so bad that it ruined the whole show. I thought that the main character would choose person A but instead ended with person B.

(This review contains spoilers - read at your own risk)
Oh where to start with Nisekoi? This anime was all over the place from the very start but it definitely became worse towards the end. It wasn't all bad though, so keep your mind open.
The storyline was non-existent, at best. There was little effort put into actually making it believable and worthy of anyone's time, and it definitely showed. So two students are "forced" to pretend to be boyfriend and girlfriend in order for their mob families to get along. That was such a cheap trick to create romance I could barely swallow it. But thatwas ok, it was just a fluke in the storyline and I was expecting everything else to be charming enough for me to ignore it. 


I was wrong. The characters were more or less charming... At first. They were likeable and cute and funny but it got old fast. It actually got very annoying for some of them. The typical love triangle: tsundere girl, shy girl, oh which one should the main guy choose? 


In no moment was I given any reason for Ichijo to care for any of them. Sure, they were pretty and "kawaii" but that was about it. Rarely was I given any glimpses of personality, and when those were presented, they made no sense at all or seemed thought up on the spot to make them more human. Of course, I didn't get what either of them saw in him, either. Soon enough more girls come forward about their feelings for him, which is just insane, and the whole thing becomes your typical harem where everyone is confused and unaware of everyone else's feelings - except they make a lot of (wrong and kind of forced) assumptions and you, the viewer, become paralyzed by the amount of mindfuck.


Onodera was the most annoying of them - she was so bland, ditzy and impossibly sweet. She never took initiative, never challenged herself, and when she did, she stepped back right away, afraid of the consequences. I really wanted to have a soft spot for her since she was so kind and considerate... But I never did. She did earn some compassion, but nothing else. She was basically on the way for me, so I could care less about her presence most of the time. 


Chitoge was the opposite. A complete mess. She was definitely modelled after the tsundered cliché, although a bit overdone in my opinion. I could never understand why she hit Ichijo instead of whom she was supposed to hit. Sometimes, it was not his fault! And he always took it well, which after the fifth or sixth time, would have been hard to imagine. She just needed some balance,  which I think she got at the end, although I wasn't too convinced. Out of all the characters, she was the one who at least seemed to grow a little, and was actually likeable. Her dilemmas and inner conflicts were somewhat real to me, and they hit home. So maybe that was why.


Ichijo... He was a very hard case for me. In one hand, I despised him since he could not make up his mind. In one moment, he liked one girl and on the other he was already fantasizing about the other one... From the beginning, it felt like he was two-timing even though his relationship with Chitoge was just a sham. But he should at least have honored his deals! Then, on the other hand, he was caring and a good friend and worried about everyone else. 

Still, he could have been a good character given the right amount of development. If only he didn't act like an immature brat whose only thoughts are about ditzy girls, I would have liked him more. 


The other characters were mostly forgettable. Shu was fine and he made me giggle with his antics, but other than that, nothing too interesting. I did like his voice actor, though, I thought it gave him a nice personality. Tachibana was very, very annoying (even more so than Onodera, if that's even possible) and I couldn't wait to see her gone from the whole series. Tsugumi was ok, I guess, considering everything.


I could never complain much about the art, although the animation team could have been a bit less lazy with their recycling and less enthusiastic with their sparkling and kawaii layouts. Sometimes the characters would get a big shot of themselves in very sexy/moe positions and animations for no reason at all. It was like Sailor Moon's transformations all over again. Other than that, everything was great. The voice actors really made it come to life, despite all the flaws, and converted me to a certain point. 


Nisekoi would have never been a brilliant anime but it could have been so much better. I mean, one could have made it seem like some thought had actually been put into its creation, but alas, it was not. Everything seemed rushed and predictable.There was room for a lot more to be done or at the very least, polished. 


I enjoyed it immensely in the first few episodes, then got extremely annoyed, then bored, then towards the end liked it a bit more. But when it ended, I felt no spark. No accomplishment. No climax. It was just "that's it?" for me. I expected it to at least have some sort of closure, but no. We got no resolve at all. I understand that it only comprises the first 50 chapters of the manga, and there's a lot more to read after that. But unless there's a follow-up to this, I see no real point in watching it unless you're a very visual person and enjoy Nisekoi. Otherwise, just stick to the manga.


So the rating I'm giving this anime is not great. However, it was cute enough to make me smile a bit, so I'll cut it some slack. The last episode was especially amusing. But unless you're willing to go through 20 episodes, most of the time not really knowing what's going on, rooting for things to happen and in the end not being sure of your feelings anymore, then give it a try. It's very japanese in the sense that it revolves around young love and doubts and all those tragedic teen aspirations. It's not deep at all, and will have you shaking your head way too often, but it's not the worst thing on earth if you have some free time.


Needed more episodes to satisfy me, but overall it was ok for the genre. Anyone into harem, comedy and romance should give it a try and judge for themselves.

Ohhh boy. Nisekoi, more like Clichekoi.
If you came here from the manga, unless you're a generic tsundere sailor don't bother with this anime. Really. The last what 3/4 episodes gave me cancer. And I'm on SS Marika and SS Kosaki.
Let me rant a bit before I go into the review proper, because I need to get this out the way. In all honesty the manga was way better. I wouldn't recommend this unless you have a ton of time and a ton of patience.
Story: 5/10
The story is unoriginal (obviously) but with the characters having way out-of-this-world backgrounds. Which makes it interesting, for like 5 chapters,then you realise it doesn't make that much a difference. Since the anime follows the manga closely in terms of plot you don't actually get any plot progression besides a larger harem because that's essentially what happens in the duration of the first season: more grils with different character tropes to suit pretty much every type of girl you could be into (except lolis). Nisekoi or plot, choose one.


Art: 5/10

The animation/artwork is very SHAFT-ish, which means its 80% fine, with 20% being seemingly awkward looking characters, and a ton of head tilts. I didn't like how the lock was 3D (felt like it to me at least) but everything else wasn't and it distracted me a lot.


Sound: 7/10

Eeeeeeh sound was normal I guess. Kosaki's and Marika's VAs were HNNNGGGGG.


Character: 6/10

Oh damn. I'm trying to not be as much as an anti ship girl as possible but holy crap Chitoge properly made me cringe. Her character was half the time okay and the other half annoyed me. I almost couldn't stand watching episodes with her, but I pushed through. And I regret all the time I wasted. Kosaki on the other hand is the queen of cockblocks. Very very very cute and adorable character but literally she doesn't get anything done plot wise. BUT HER SMILE DOEEE SO INNOCENT AND PURE. Tsugumi felt like a less annoying tsundere. And finally Marika. Single handedly carrying the plot progression. Ruri and Shuu were great supporting characters though. 


Enjoyment: 6/10

I didn't really like this anime.


TL;DR:

Read the manga, watch the OVAs if you wanna hear your favorite girl with sound

It was all the hype back then. The Jump romance series is getting an anime! By SHAFT nonetheless!
With people jumping right and left, did it live up to its hype?
Story - 6/10
The story revolves around Ichijou Raku. The heir to some kind of Yakuza family. One day, on his way to school, he was kneed-to-the-face by a transfer student Kirisaki Chitoge, who later is revealed to be a gangster family's daughter. After a few things happened, he and Chitoge must fake being lovers to stop a turf war.
And the other side of the plot involves Raku's promise with a girl from his childhood, a pendant,and a few keys.


So it's a usual "two-people-must-fake-being-something-they're-not" kind of story. It appears to be pretty boring at first, but there's something about it that comes out as... refreshing somehow.


I don't know why, it's just... maybe it has something to do with the art style, but the way that the story is told is just so... I don't know.


Unlike the ever-dragging manga, since the anime is just parts of it, the pacing felt like a normal Romance Comedy series.


With the usual stuff. You know, hot springs, homestay, beach, and others.


P.S. Nisekoi is the anime with the most monologue I've ever watched. like, seriously.


Art - 8/10


The art style of Nisekoi is somewhat colorful. Like really, most of the color for the backgrounds consists of patterns. Only the characters look normal to the eye.


That's what gives this anime the feeling of fluffiness. The cuteness goddamnit.


Sound - 7/10


Music-wise, Nisekoi is on the average side. The music is mostly soft and light, befitting of the series' personality.


Character - 6/10


To be honest, Nisekoi's characters are nothing too unique or new. They all have their archetype. But they live up to it wonderfully, with just enough knicks and knacks to make themselves different.


Raku is a Harem protagonist. Therefore, he will be nice and caring. He's a bit clueless, but not that much. He also  have something that most protagonists lack, self-awareness! Even if just a bit.


Chitoge is the main heroine. So she takes the Tsundere card. What's a bit different about her is that as the series progresses, she's mostly Dere and less Tsun. Meaning, she's more in-touch with her feelings than most Tsunderes


Onodera is the generally shy one. She doesn't have much backstory or anything, but she's my personal favorite. SO MUCH GODDAMN KAWAII!!!


Tsugumi, by herself is quite the Tsundere, actually. She appears to be a guy at first, but as we all know, if there's a new guy in a harem, it's most likely a trap. As such, she's the reverse-trap.


Marika, is actually quite interesting. You would think that she's the princess, but after a few events, her character is quite unique.


Also, if you're wondering who's the childhood friend character is, fear not! For everyone is basically a childhood friend in a sense.


So overall, Nisekoi characters are quite dry, but they still have some juice to make it more interesting.


Overall - 7/10


Nisekoi isn't terribly deep, and it's not pretending to be deep. It's a light-hearted show that focuses mostly on the character interactions.


If you want a fluffy Romance Comedy series with an open-ended finale, this might just be perfect for you.


If you want a deep series with a real plot progression, you might have to look elsewhere.

Even though this show has been branded as a generic harem anime, I really enjoyed it because of the focus of the show. In too many harem anime, the MC is portrayed as some Jesus figure who is good at everything and is the main obsession of the girls in the show. However, Nisekoi does something special by having the girls be the main characters, and the guy a reflection of what they value in a person. Even though it is kinda uncomfortable to have all these attractive girls like one guy, it never becomes creepy because the reason they like him is not becausehe is good at everything, rather it's because of their specific characterizations. Each girl likes him for separate reasons, due to the fact that all of them approach their relationship differently, but the reasons are consistent enough with a single personality that it never feels as though their view of him is disjointed. 


(This is for the manga, Definitely read it.) 

I also really enjoy how they chose the final girl that the guy wanted to be with, as it paints a complex portrayal of what love actually is, namely not something that is felt but something that one deliberately chooses so that their partner can be happy. However, I am not giving this anime a 10 simply because it didn't make me as emotional as other shows that I have watched.

Recycling cliche anime elements and trying to refashion it with good art and sound. 
They took a lot of liberty with the cliche anime parts, such as the childhood friend that becomes lover, oh and another one, oh and another one , and on top of that a key and lock that symbolizes their friendship and promise for each other. And I don't say liberty with a compliment, more like indulging. 
Colorful art with good looking characters, with a really forced plot to make the two main characters stuck with each other, and a very predictable development of how their fake love relationship would turnout in the end. \n\n
But despite that, you could still enjoy the ride with with the nice art and sound and voice acting. In particular, I really like Onodera's voice, it is very feminine yet mature, and it really fits the character so well, but the voice standalone is sooo nice, I can't help myself to listen to it again. She is personally my favorite heroine, her gentleness contrasts from the other heroines; one who is hot tempered and flashy character design, and the other girl who is all over the main for no good reason. \n\n
All in all, a good anime for you to just turn off your brain and just enjoy some aesthetics. Nothing that original, just taking cliche elements and abusing them to a huger degree that you might find yourself face palming several times.

This is my first review ever, so please bear with me. 
It's been so long since I last watched a harem anime that genuinely pulled at my heartstrings that I am compelled to write a review for Nisekoi. If you're looking for lighthearted romance with quirky characters, then this is the show to watch. 
Story: 7/10
The story of Nisekoi is nothing particularly special. It's just your typical harem fare with four beautiful girls vying for the attention of a hopelessly dense guy. However, I do appreciate the fact that there is some self-depricating humor thrown into the mix to break the monotony of all ofthe anime cliches. The comedy is one of the show's strongest features and pulls it from the depths of mediocrity.


Art: 9/10

There are very stunning visuals in Nisekoi and all of the details really came together to make every scene appealing to the eyes. There were a few places where Shaft's quirky style of animation and color did detract from the overall mood, but for the most part the art was well done.


Sound: 8/10

To be entirely honest, I don't really pay attention to the soundtracks of anime unless there's something that really stands out. I do have to say that the opening and ending themes were pretty great though, and Nisekoi has A LOT of ending themes. 


Characters: 9/10

The characters were really the best part about this anime. I has my misgivings about them at first since harem characters tend to be very one-dimensional but the characters in Nisekoi felt very real, or at least as real as harem characters can get. Despite the fact that they all fall into typical harem character archetypes (the clueless guy, the tsundere, the nice classmate, the tomboy, the childhood friend... the list goes on), they still have unique characteristics that set them apart from the pack. The side characters also definitely helped to add comedy to the entire show, and I felt that at times the side characters were just as important as the main characters. 


Enjoyment: 8/10

Definitely an enjoyable show if you don't mind romcoms.


Overall: 8/10

All in all, Nisekoi is a pretty fun romcom harem anime, with genuine characters and a somewhat interesting (and exceedingly ridiculous) premise. The drama isn't overbearing, the comedy is never too over-the-top, and the romance is twinged with the perfect mix of bittersweet memories and the blossoms of newfound love. There is truly never a dull moment in this anime.

Nisekoi is a romantic comedy with perhaps an emphasis on the "comedy". The chemistry between the characters is notable, and the benign (and not so benign) machinations of the deadly duo, Shuu and Ruri, are guaranteed to make you laugh. This must be the first anime for which I've liked the supporting characters significantly more than the main. This is not to say that the main characters aren't likeable, for they surely are, but the side characters - in particular Shuu and Ruri - are simply hilarious.
On the romance front, there is an overarching plotline about the past of the MC that hasn't yet beenresolved at episode 16 (of 20). It would not be wholly inaccurate to call this a harem anime, but as of episode 16 it looks like there will be a single-girl ending.\n\n
Charming characters, a multitude of laugh-out-loud moments, great art, and the unique animation/direction style of the Shaft team (which made me erroneously think this was a poor Bakemonogatari rip-off in the first episode) make this a must-watch show in my book for anyone who enjoys a zany slice of life romantic comedy. The first episode isn't that strong though, and I would recommend you give this two or three episodes to grow on you before you decide whether or not to keep watching.

Summary: Nisekoi is a more modern take on the harem genre. So if you find harem cringe, just stay away from this. If you're like me and love harem, this will definitely end up on your favorite anime of all time.  
Story: I don't usually like anime where people pretend to be lovers, but Nisekoi is the exception to the rule. Especially when the girl is a tsundere! The other characters like Onodera and Tachibana really add to the story and make the "slice of life" enjoyable to watch and very entertaining.
8/10
Art: The art style of this anime is something you just fall inlove with. The character's movements and how the art conveys emotion are definitely what I look for in all anime. And of course the overall looks.

9/10


Sound: The soundtrack really suits the situations in this anime, which is a defining factor in whether many romance anime are good or not. Voice acting in this anime also really suits the characters. The lively characters in animation have a lively voice etc.

9/10


Characters: As I stated before I love tsundere. Chitoge Kirisaki is one of my favorite characters in this anime. The other characters like Raku and his harem also have great personalities. They are all unique and there is definitely controversy over who is "best girl."


Enjoyment: Overall I really liked this anime and had a great time watching it. I can't wait for season two and am up to date with the manga. But until the GO TEAM CHITOGE.


Overall 9/10

"So much UGH with this" 
Usual complaints about the harem genre are understandable. Add a dozen other genres, add one guy with no personality, add a bunch of sexy girls, and make a love triangle with the two top gals duking it out (With a clear winner on some occasions). Sometimes this formula becomes ether fun, or a little frustrating. Nisekoi is nether....... Nisekoi is actually BEYOND frustration. It dives too much into torture territory. And here's why....... 
It all starts beautifully enough. Vivid colors, and crisp animation. The characters have really funny facial expressions during some episodes. Everybody is having fun. Everything is lollipops,and gumdrops. And then....the nightmare begins. It goes crashing head first into some filler, then into more filler, and then finally half asses everything right into a cliffhanger. The plot gets tossed away immediately in this show (During the middle), and it does not coming back. Usually a show would have filler, however a show would go back to its original story after going through the evolution (Or dozens of panty shots) of its characters. Not Nisekoi though. It literally tosses the point right out the window. That is the huge problem that just will not leave. And it is the reason over how Nisekoi is frustrating. 


And it keeps adding more girls, and romance pointlessly. One episode it is a love triangle, then another it is a love square. Then eventually it turns into a love pentagon, and then yes..... they will add another girl during season two! So it will be a freaking love hexagon! Even the added unique quirks get forgotten. The show explains that the families of the two main characters are actually mobsters. And yet that added seasoning to make this a unique anime gets barely used, and then tossed away later on. What is the point of even explaining who their families are? They are only around for one purpose ("These two better get married, or throats will get slashed!"). And where are the drug deals? And the hookers?....... A mob life can't be about sipping tea, and fapping to hentai at home while the kids are away at school. 


More annoyances appear in Nisekoi. The characters give out model-esc poses/looks. They always wonder "why" for no reason. "Why am I in love?", "Why did she say that?", "Why did this person breathe?!?!", etc. And the *big* praised treasure trove of funny facial expressions eventually runs out, and the show sticks with the same spit takes (And the same animation of heads of the characters being bouncing around in bubble form with a single color background) as the main source for comedy. There are tiny fragments of ecchi elements. And sadly those fragments are not memorable at all.


With the ax being put away after grinding, and before the metaphorical chopping off of the head. There are a few good things about Nisekoi that have to be praised. The girls are charming, and they each have their own personality. This show is fantastic through out the beginning. And music in this show is always ever changing, but really sweet to hear. Comedy during the finale is fantastic. The final moments do not exactly make it worth while, there is a cliffhanger as mentioned once before in this review, however it at least ends with a pretty funny big bang. 


On a personal note: This show is a complete massive waste of time. If you want to watch this show. Then ether watch the first 8-10 episodes, skip everything between 10-19, then watch the last one, and call it a day. Or wait a few dozen years when this show ends, and then marathon everything in a week. Or watch this show, and don't follow the plot at all during the whole twenty episodes. Or read the entire manga series instead, because from what I hear you can actually get a chance to know how it will all end. Sorry for being complicated, Im just giving out good game plans here. I was disappointed with the mafia aspect not being used. That was the main reason why I bothered to tune in. It would have been fun seeing that aspect being used more, since it could have been a far more interesting story. There are OVA's you say? Well, then.....those are a bunch of middle fingers in the a**hole as well. I would have given this show a higher score. I just could not, because it is not the type of show that is re-watchable. The animation, the comedy, the designs, and the music. They are all good. It is just that if there was some follow through with the plot. Then I would have at least bumped it up 2 points. I mean even really terrible nonsensical anime shows would try to go back to its main purpose, and finish. Nisekoi just loves dangling treats in front of your face, until you accidentally trip, and slam into a wall. I might give the manga a shot one day. As for this show, I rather forget about it. Believe me. There are fun times to be had here, but if you are going to assume that it's all about the story. You will be frustrated. And if you have your theories ready to be answered, then get ready to toss everything away in the trash. 


Otherwise, it won't be a fun time.

Neko here! Another review from me, filled with very much personal point of view opinion. Let's try to be subjective with this one, why? I mean, it's Nisekoi, where you weekly dosage of cuteness served.
I'm not really into talking about studio or director. But this one is quite SHAFT-ed. Does anyone here remember Zetsubou Sensei, Madoka Magica, EF series, and Denpa Onna plus Monogatari series? It's all about metric figures in your background, much flash-based animation, vector image flying, something like that. (with due all respect, I'm sorry. I'm not mentioning that was bad. I'm a design student who studies those form too. But, ifyou are the kind of people who hate things like those filling the background, please restrain from blame everything to the anime. For our own good.)


The story tells about Ichijou Raku, a son of a yakuza gang boss. He was arranged into some kind of 'dating' condition by his father to his arch-enemy gang leader's daughter. That condition was made because they want to stop their gang member bloodshed. Sounds like Romeo & Juliet? Sounds very deep? Not really.


This is your typical harem situation, but quite safe for work, yet very much cute girl intensifies. Yes, very cute. Reallyyyyy cute.


Did I said "cute" three times before? Oh, no kidding, I'm serious, it's very much really cute. Make it five.


Kirisaki Chitoge, with her Tsundere trait makes Raku more confused about who he's falling in love with. Onodera Kosaki, with her naturally cute attitude, especially when she's shy around Raku. Seishirou Tsugumi, a male with cute gap moe and also hidden BIG secret await to be revealed. And after few episode you can see Tachibana Marika with her loyalty to somebody she loves. Every girl here has their own good point, and it makes them really cute.


Looking for Moe? Cuteness? Romantic Teenager Comedy? Lucky bastard who surrounded by many cute girls? Yes this is anime for you. HAREM BANZAI!


Vanilla tasted harem. That's what on my mind about this anime, maybe only for now. Later? Dunno, ask the comic artist.


Feel free to rate down here, yes, around down there.

"I want to eat octopus balls."
-Chitoge Kirisaki, Episode 17
My god, this show is cringe-worthy. First of, all of the main characters (except Raku) are fucking tsundere. Second, all of them except for Marika are always too shy to say what's on their mind, leading to the same scenario happening over and over and over and over and over again. And when they finally work up the courage, they're interrupted in one way or another. Over and over and over and over again. This gets sickening.
These characters are some of the most dense fucks I've ever seen, especially Raku (which reminds me of Ragu). It onlytakes him 19 episodes to finally identify what someone else is thinking. Only 19. He is a very painful protagonist..


The threats of Claude and Marika were interesting concepts that I was very upset to see forgotten an episode later with just a rare mention of them later.


I personally am not a fan of harems as they often leave me yelling "Come on! Don't be so fucking stupid, pick someone and get on with your life". While this show was not as bad as I expected it to be, I still managed to lose my voice after yelling profanities every time someone did something unbelievably stupid..


My favorite character was Tsugumi, only because her naiveness and shyness was justified. However, I loathe Onodera, seeing as she had PLENTY of opportunities to make some moves, yet most of the time decided not to.


Honestly, it just felt like everyone was stalling. A war of attrition. I hope the second season isn't this miserable..

This i guess you could say the first actual anime i watched. Yes ive watched Pokemon and Yu-Gi-Oh as well as Dragon Ball Z but this is the first anime i watched thats in Japanese. I found this anime extremely hard to stop watching. I loved the characters and i found i could relate to the characters. I read some reviews talking about how the plot is thin and other things but i feel as if thats being to harsh. Can you compare this to other harem anime? yes. but no other harem anime will be able to hold a candle to the character designor character development that Nisekoi brings. Sorry if this review is not "dense" enough or says why i rated it the way i did. I loved every second of this anime.

Nisekoi is like playing a game of League of Legends.  You don't know why you enjoy it.  It's super addicting and although it isn't the best anime around, you enjoy it way too much.  Nisekoi should be garbage.  I shouldn't like a rom com harem, but it just is.  It definitely is hard to describe.  What makes Nisekoi work so well?  We'll find out in this terrible review.
Presentation (Art, Sound):
Shaft does well with its presentation in general.  The art is very colourful with beautiful character designs and just Shaft backgrounds.  Without previous exposure to Shaft works(man that sounds dirty af LMAO), the backdrops will probably not feel as nostalgic and memorable than someone who has watched for example: the Monogatari series.


Sound is pretty good.  The openings are alright from what I have heard, but I didn't really pay attention to any of the EDs.  Soundtrack is standard slice of life with one certain good theme that occurs repeatedly a few times.


Story: 

The story is pretty generic.  I can't tell if Nisekoi is based around Romeo and Juliet because the stories are pretty similar.  It's decent I guess.  The plot is what you would expect from any romantic comedy.


Characters:

The girls are what carry this show.  Almost every girl in the MC's harem is best girl material.  (Chitoge best girl, Marika worst sorry).  Raku himself is kinda bland, but his seiyuu does a good job of making his reactions funny.


Enjoyment:

I don't think I've ever joined a rom com so much.  In Nisekoi, so little happens, but I still loved it!  Whenever there was a cute blush by Chitoge, I was like DAMN, nosebleed starts.  The banter and conversations are done very well.  The comedy is freaking TOP NOTCH.  I was laughing super hard at many moments.  Sure, some situations are cliche and full of tropes, but to me, they didn't get too bland and generic.  There is also so much frustration while watching this anime.  The awkwardness and hesitation in this anime boggles my mindShaft had their over the top visuals to completely persuade me to love Nisekoi.


Conclusion:

Nisekoi is a generic rom com harem that CAN come off as likable due to its intensely beautiful art and fun characters.  If you don't mind any plot progression and just want an anime with a ton of comedy and cute beginnings of romance, Nisekoi will be perfect for you!  Also it's great to just  insert yourself into Raku's place and think about how epic your life would be with a beautiful harem like his.  Have fun picking your best girl! :D

Nisekoi is a very interesting anime, I thought it was going to be average at best but instead I was hooked immediately and ended up really enjoying the show.
Story:
Nisekoi follows Raku, the heir to a Yakuza clan who just wants to live a normal life. Raku along with his classmates have to deal with regular highschool life, but for Raku and the female lead, Chitoge, there is more than meets the eye. Chitoge's father is the leader of a rival gang and to prevent a gang war Raku and Chitoge are forced to pretend to be lovers. Of course all would be alright, if theydidn't hate each other and if Raku wasn't in love with someone else. The main focus, along with Chitoge and Raku's fake relationship is Raku's quest to find the girl he made a promise to ten years prior. This all unfolds nicely and catches the viewer's attention early on. My main problems are that the pacing is off at times, the plot twists complicate the romance, and the romance develops very slowly. These are the biggest detractors to an otherwise great and interesting story.

7/10


Art:

It's SHAFT, so the style is colorful and abstract. The characters are all well designed and the environments and backgrounds look amazing. I can't think of anything I don't like about the art of this show.

9/10


Sound:

The sound is really well done, the voice actors fit the characters really well, especially Chitoge and Onodera's VAs. The music is great as well, except the opening songs which are average at best. Overall I do really love the sound.

9/10


Characters:

Nisekoi is primarily a romance, and thus it needs good characters or it will fail. Nisekoi has very good characters. Every character has a good personality and develops well (for the most part) over the course of the show. Chitoge develops well and the ending is incredibly heartwarming and develops the relationship between Chitoge and Raku well. It does so for Raku and Onodera also. Shu and Ruri do not develop well, but they're side characters so it doesn't matter as much as the main characters. One gripe is that the characters are just so inept at confessing love, they just don't do it, and when they try the confession is interrupted.

8/10


Enjoyment:

Nisekoi really surprised me, the story was deeper than I expected and I could not stop watching once I started.

9/10


Overall:

I recommend Nisekoi wholeheartedly, just make note that the romance may not go in your favor and you could finish the series feeling empty, but thats what season 2 is for.

8.4/10

What I wanted: A comedic, Slice of Life Romance anime to offset everything else I've been watching lately.
What I got:  A comedic, Slice of Life Romance anime to offset everything else I've been watching lately.
Story (6/10):
Nisekoi is the same story of an oblivious male main character and a cast of girls who are absolutely head over heels for him. While it's not an original concept, the execution is very well done and is enjoyable regardless of the fact.
Art (8/10):
Nisekoi's art never strikes me as particularly lazy, unfinished, or uninspired. While it's not groundbreaking, it is pleasant to look at and serves the purpose oftelling the story.\n\n
Sound (7/10):\n
While not very memorable, each piece of music is pleasant and fits the tune of the show. My only complaint is that there's not a surplus of tracks, and the music sometimes gets repetitive having heard it so many times.\n\n
Character (5/10):\n
Where Nisekoi falls shortest is in characterization. Each character is a "cardboard cutout" of various SoL anime tropes and frequently does little to deviate from the formulas already in place.\n\n
Enjoyment (10/10): \n
Despite the other scores, I enjoyed Nisekoi as much as I've enjoyed almost any other anime. I came in expecting it to be a show that didn't deviate from the norm and this exactly what I got. \n\n
Average of Scores (7.2/10) \n
My Overall Score (9/10)\n
What you see is what you get, and despite being unoriginal, Nisekoi shows that you can still take what's been done time and time again before and make it just as entertaining to watch.\n

Here's my advice. If you like romance, comedy, slice of life, animes that take forever to finish but have good animation, sound and characters, then this anime is for you.
My Review:
I have to say that Nisekoi isn't really one when it comes to bringing something new to the table, considering the plot is something that has been done already (*Cough... Love Hina) but for some reason, this anime / manga series really brings, something interesting to the table, something that wasn't done in Love Hina or other animes / mangas that had a similar plot.
First off. Nisekoi's animation is quite interesting for me. It hasall of these bright and vibrant colors along with a very slight fade to it. Especially those scenes when Raku and Onodera have a "moment" . Those scenes look the best to me, I don't why. Along with the drawing style of the characters just seem to work so well.\n\n
The story is okay. Its really nothing but mediocre material that all of us have seen before, but I like it so far so I don't really care.\n\n
I would have to say that the characters are the highlight of this anime in my opinion. First theres Raku, obviously the guy that every single teen girl in this series is in love with. Some took slower to realize their lover for him (*cough Tsugumi / Haru) then you got that classic perverted and annoying best friend of the main character that gets the shit kicked out of him everyday by a tsundre for just being there or being perverted. Then we got supporting characters like Raku's and chitoges dads where, if they weren't in the anime / manga, the plot wouldn't have happened. \n\n
With a nothing but mediocre plot, average but fun characters, and with all of us doubtfully waiting for a season 3, I have to award this overall anime with an 8. Only cause I had a lot of fun watching / reading both the anime and the manga, and only cause the story could've been a little different and a little more original.

This is the possibly blandest and most generic show I've seen in my long and impressive anime career. 
let's start with the good. The music’s pretty decent, and the art style is very colorful.
Let's start with the bad.
Every time the MC meets a new female character it's always the same dull and vapid background story. The MC made a promise to her that she will see his schlong and get kids and yadayadayada. 
Him clearly being demented at such a young age, doesn't remember this and never in the show contacts a physician. And that's pretty much the story.
So if you like unnecessary padding, predictableendings, and mediocre r-34 material this is the show for you.\n\n

Nisekoi was an anime that I made fun of with my friends for the longest time. I personally think harems are just hilarious because of the fact that the MC is absolutely clueless and the girls all fight over one guy BUT I personally do in fact enjoy harems. Maybe I'm a bit biased because I enjoy harems but Nisekoi was very enjoyable for me. I have not read the manga yet so purely just basing my review on the anime I give it a 9/10. At first I was very surprised that the studio that made this was Shaft. I thought that Nisekoi wouldhave some weird visuals and wasn't really sure if Shaft could pull it off but wow, I'll never doubt Shaft again. Their art and animation is all top notch and it really made me enjoy Nisekoi.


Story 7/10:

Story is unique but nothing really compelling. The main MC apparently makes a promise to a girl 10 years ago that if they were to meet again they would marry but he doesn't know who he gave it to and that's basically the premise of the story. Every girl has some sort of connection to the past and the audience is trying to determine who the girl is. Overall, this story is honestly perfect for a harem, it helps introduce different characters without making it seem TOO forceful. Of course there are instances where a girl just appears out of nowhere but it's far better than other harems that I've seen.


Art 10/10:

I'll say it again, Shaft makes pretty good art. Actually scratch that,they are insane with their art. All the characters look brilliant, they're very detailed and you can totally tell all of them apart. The backgrounds are amazing. I know Shaft is known for some weird backgrounds but everything fits so perfectly. 


Sound 10/10:

To be honest, I dont really know much to write about sound in a review besides the fact that I really like the OP and there are A LOT of EDS. I really enjoyed all of them and also the voice actors fit perfectly with the characters so yeah 10/10.


Character 10/10:

Like any romantic anime, the characters are the most important part of the story. I'm not particularly fond with the main MC as he's the typical harem MC who is clueless about everything and does not say what he wants to say but he isn't the worst. The girls are awesome tho. Chitoge is the typical harem but she's really adorable! She's my favorite girl because she actually feels real. She gets jealous, she gets mad, she gets irritated and she just shows normal human reactions. 

Onodera is also one of my favorite heroines in this anime. She's absolutely a precious angel that isn't about revenge and just wants best for other people. You know, I'm sick and tired of romantic rivalries between girls but Nisekoi doesn't do that. This anime allows the MC to be able to choose through experience rather than the girls fighting till the end.


Overall, I'm sad that I misjudged Nisekoi. I thought it would be garbage but no, it was actually pretty enjoyable. The characters were all pretty cool and Shaft did a great job with it. Honestly if it were not for Shaft I would've probably gave this an 8.

How to make a love story getting more and more complicated? Nisekoi
For a head start, I never read its manga so I will not be comparing the anime and its manga. This review should be based on the anime itself only.
Story: 6
Well, the story itself isn't original but not too bad. We have our male protagonist (Raku) having a promise with his childhood friend (an unknown girl). 10 years later as a teenager, he had forgotten how she looked like and the only thing he knew is the girl has a key which can unlock the pendant given. The story goes on with Raku tryingto find clues about this promised girl, while being swarmed with a lot of problems.


Art: 8


If you know Shaft you should expect better quality in art and animation. I will not be writing too much in this section.


Sound: 8


OPs (both sung by ClariS, the "old" one) and EDs (sung by VA themselves) are nice so just go ahead and grab them. I personally don't pay too much attention on the OST since they are pretty common in romcom series (and hence easily forgotten).


Character: 7


#TeamOnodera or #TeamChitoge?


Raku is the typical dense male protagonist who is always caring to his friends. Kosaki (or Onodera) is the typical nice and very shy girl and Chitoge (or Kirisaki) is the typical bossy girl with some good (yet hidden) personalities. While it seems like Onodera has the upper hand in terms of (almost) everything, Chitoge improves a lot throughout the series and is able to compete with Onodera to win Raku's heart.


Not going to tell you who will win, of course :P


Regarding side characters, Tsugumi and Marika are pretty much redundant in this series to be honest. Maiko (Raku's friend) and Ruri (Kosaki's friend) are the supportive duo who always try to find chances to get Raku and Kosaki together.


PS: I haven't sided towards any "teams" since I have yet to finish Nisekoi season 2. 


Enjoyment: 8


I personally enjoy the series in terms of harem and comedy, but as a romance series I just don't feel like there is "enough" romance here. Most of the romantic scenes end up with issues e.g. someone is going to confess after hiding his/her feelings for a long time but suddenly "something" happens and interrupts the confession (derp). 


This is probably how the manga plot goes so the issue is with the plot itself.


Overall: 8


In short, the series is enjoyable (albeit with a few fan service scenes). I will give a score of 8 out of 10.


~~~~


This is NOT relevant or important but is still bugging me: Why did the community name #TeamOnodera and #TeamChitoge instead of standardising their first/last names? (i.e Kosaki/Chitoge or Onodera/Kirisaki) :|

I haven't been involved in the Anime world since very early childhood until very recently, I'm happy to report that I've spent the last 2 weeks since my reintroduction, catching up on the feeling of splendour which I've been missing for the better part of my life so far.
This series is completely entertaining from start to end, with the very premise being both realistic and comical at the same point; its the sort of situation where you think "this has probably actually happened before in real life" (in regards to the whole basis of two power houses wanting to unite for one purpose or another(in this case peace through dating) etc).


I would highly recommend this anime to anyone who wants to take a plunge into the swimming pool of anime, but wants to keep their hair dry at the same point.


I really hope that there will be a season 2 to look forward to as I just want things with these characters to work out. (I'm rotting for Chitoge).


Thanks for reading this, I hope you'll at least give this series a try; it might not be for everyone, but in my opinion, you need to at least give this a shot!

Fair warning, this anime is probably never going to end; it's one of those that keeps on adding character after character until you can't keep track of them all anymore. The harem is strong with this main character. 
That said, if you aren't looking for a "serious" romantic anime, look no further than Nisekoi. Hell, if you're looking for a non-serious romantic anime 2 years from now; this shit is probably still going to be on-air. You'll probably get some laughs out of it and enjoy the characters, but try to look any deeper than the shallow humor and gags; the whole anime begins tocrack and fall apart.\n\n
P.S. I have read the manga up to chapter 125 and it still hasn't moved the plot forward more than it was at chapter 25.

This anime has a GREAT kick off, right from the beginning, but it's really sad that they have to ruin it with the consistency. The main story is suppose to be Raku Ichijou finding the love of his life: the girl he made a promise to ten years ago and sealed with a pendant and a key. The problem is that he is stuck in a situation where he must pretend to be the fake lover of Chitoge Kirisaki, who he does not like, for the sake of his and her family.
The first half of the anime is really good. The beginning, especially, is amazing.The plot is focused, very interesting, and I laughed a whole bunch. I really enjoyed it. However, after awhile, the anime became very unfocused and it started to feel like I was being dragged. It wasn't as funny anymore, the art got lazy, and the main story was lost. The idea of finding his "mystery girl" was completely forgotten. Also, his affections for Kosaki Onodera is also inconsistent and frustrating. Their relationship NEVER develops, although I do understand that they keep it "neutral" to keep his relationship with the other girls balanced. But if they're trying to keep a "balance", they completely failed at that part as well. There is too much screen time with Chitoge and too little with the other three girls. I get that Chitoge is the main female character, but if she is, they could have at least made her a bit less annoying. A successful anime TO ME would have wonderful, complex main characters who I grow to love. But honestly, I like Kosaki and Marika a lot more than Chitoge. It is kind of depressing to have an anime where I don't even root for the "main couple".\n
The ending is funny and enjoyable, but not satisfying. We don't find out who he ends up with nor does it seem like he cares anymore. The pendant got broken and that's the last we heard of it.\n\n
Nisekoi is very inconsistent and at times, frustrating. Great artwork, but became lazy and sloppy. Unsatisfying ending. Although I am pretty disappointed with it, Nisekoi is still a funny and enjoyable anime. In my opinion, the beginning deserves a 9/10, first half deserves an 8/10, the rest would probably be a 6/10. Average for me is a 7/10.

Nisekoi can be seen as another generic harem romance show, or it could add to the genre, making it shine through the malignant mass of harems.
 Personally, it didn't do it for me. A sheer lack of story and generic characters makes it another square harem show, adding no sustenance to the already trash genre. What brings the score up is the overall animation and sound, which is expected coming from the same studio that animated the Monogatari series.
Story - 6/10
Sometimes you look at the genres of an anime before watching, and you see various tags, such as slice of life, comedy, romance, harem, etc.What do you think? You haven't read the synopsis, and only saw the cover art for the series. You may think, "wow, this sounds like another generic series," or something along those lines. For Nisekoi, you would be right.


Now, the overall premise of the show is something I'm not too accustomed with, as I haven't seen too many series with the yakuza or gangs being involved, especially in a harem anime, so I guess you could say it was a breath of fresh air for me. But that was the only redeeming thing the series could muster up. It only played as a driving force for any sort of conflict during the series.


Art - 9/10


As mentioned before, this series is animated by Shaft. That being said, there of course is going to be givens, like the amount of head tilts in a given episode. All seriousness, they did a wonderful job animating dialogue, and kept a more dialogue heavy episode interesting, similar to what they did in the Monogatari series. The only thing that really irked me regarding the art-style is that every girl in the harem has the same exact facial structure and smile, only differentiating from from hair color/style and eyes. 


Sound - 9/10


No character in this series had a voice that didn't sound like it matched them. With that, the soundtrack for the show was also good, matching the mood of the scene.


For the OP and ED though, I cannot say anything about, as I ended up watching the open-less and credit-less mode of the show, somehow.


Character - 6/10


Character-wise, this show also lacks, comparatively to the story. The same fault lies in the characters, as we have our generic tsundere (two really), perverted male friend of the MC, and square "good girl" that of course the MC has a crush on. 


Enjoyment and Overall - 8/10 & 7/10


While the story and characters were very lackluster, the series somehow kept me entertained and even a little captivated with it. I didn't have issues in wanting to take breaks in between chunks of episodes, and I wanted to know what happens next, from the beginning to the end of the season. This plus Shaft-y animation and decent soundtrack and voices, I feel this series would deserve its score.

ADDITIONAL: (After I make review Nisekoi: I got something important to say)
TRY NOT TO BINGE WATCHING NISEKOI. You may enjoy it more since the core story is expanded in the series of high school life of Raku.
Don't forget again...I recommend you to read the manga first (at least until Chapter 100) then you can happily watch this. Cheers! Chapter 100 is the last episode of Nisekoi: if don't make mistake.
NISEKOI Review:
I fix my previous comment about Nisekoi being a shoujo anime while it is characterised as shounen. I honestly can't decide it belong to which genre hoenstly...but it might be good in both realm (shoujo& shounen). Well...I leave it to you guys.


First thing I REALLY notice from Nisekoi is....ANIMATION brought by SHaft.


Haha...seriously, Nisekoi is Bakemonogatari Series in less dark and more casual appearance. A shoujo version of Bakemonogatari Series in term of visual (and less harem so I say)


I am a big fans of bakemonogatari and the entire story, up to marvellous Kizumonogatari. Shaft have done a great thing with its eccentric art and style and it was so awesome I could cry.


Well...but...I just don't seem to be in a much click to fit those styles with Nisekoi tho. I am not saying it's not good..but the story is too casual to get an eccentric kind of presentation. And the way character drawed (which is resemble the Nisekoi manga by a lot that I don't find it matching as well woth the presentation) Altho I still love that small detail in term of character presentation and camera focus, gestures details (like them spinning around, sparkling, over-colored, I found it very nice)


Comparing with Tonari no Kaibutsu-Kun which I am much more fond with. I think that image more fitting IMHO.


Story:

Hmm..hard to say, but I found it great but not that masterpiece. But...for younger audience (for example high schooler shoujo) it is very perfect imo. But not so for more mature audience. I prefer a straight forward love relationship like in the Tonari Kaibutsu-Kun (sorry to brought that up again). I like how Shaft brought up the first episode, I was so curious about it (I haven't read the manga yet up until I finish the Nisekoi: ) The idea of love story from 10 years ago with the only link is a pendant and a key (but even you know 5 years old talking about love and getting married is something that I can't never understand) How chitoge make the first entrance and meet Raku, it was unique. And then one by one new character appears, and make the mystery a tad more complicated. How they ended up with Nisekoi (Fake Love) between Chitoge and Raku (which is I found it to be forced in terms of story)


But then.....the story stray


They essence of those pendant story and the fake relationship is fading halfway. And it turn to be a daily high school love life with a coward way of expressing their own feelings (Seriously, Onodera and Raku maybe the DENSEST anime character I have ever watched, I will be in the Ruri teams and shout "JUST MADE UP COUPLE ALREADY!) It may be cool for anime (since manga I don't really bother with extended plot and long story, but for anime I prefer straight forward story) ..again..it might be cool if Raku and Onodera get together as a couple without knowing the pendant and then boom! Chitoge appear with the key (oh well but then it broke the nice manga) Yeah I am just saying some plot twist, hha.


There is not much scenes that make my heart skip beat or beat faster like in any other love genre anime (let say Chuunibyou Demo Koi ga Shitai and Tonari no Kaibutsu) which is I found it sad. 


Sound:

It was great. Shaft love ClariS and so do I. It is matching with the genre, fun and catchy. The soundtrack also ok, casual for slice of life (I found it similar with Umaru) But it is lacking in terms of romance ambience. But well...that again following the story which happen to have less romance climax. I love STEP, TRICK BOX, and CLICK.


Character:

As I said, they are high schooler and I can understand if they are too shy to say their own feelings but Raku and Onodera is WAAYYY to DENSE and they can't read the atmosphere at all (so many time I just wanna scream "JUST CONFESS NOW,AHO!") Chitoge kept on lying to herself and everybody. Oh well...I can get along with them anyway.


I like Tusugumi by the way (Tsugumi team yey!) I haven't read the manga to finish so I don't know how this long extended plot ended but I got my own plot twist where actually the girl with key is actually Tsugumi (shot myself in the head) Go Tsugumi.


I watched Nisekoi: with hope that the story get more mature but yeah...it still the same. The first 3 episode get my expectation up with Chitoge acknowledge her own feeling but then she keep on doing stupid things (like punching Raku to the moon) instead of showing her affection to Raku.



For Note:

I just follow the manga from Chapter 62 and I notice a missing story or not sure, but it is not in the Nisekoi: Hope the story is going good and I don't ended up realising that Nisekoi: is a filler or whatsoever.


Summary:

Nisekoi story is too long with rather slow progression in the core story but I enjoy it a lot. There are so many time I laugh with the comedy and so many time I wondering about the core relationship mystery.


Just like Kyoko sensei said "It is nice to be young!"
