Something quite cliche can be something quite enjoyable to the viewer.
Story-(Rate-6) 
Nisekoi's story isn't anything original.
It's actually "Love Hina and Oreshura smashed together" when you think about it.
It's execution?
It's fair, but it really bogs the anime down when there are constant interruptions
in ACTUAL character developing moments. Also, the ending is really lackluster.
Art-(Rate-10)
This show was animated by Studio Shaft and it doesn't disappoint.
It's bright vivid colors really stand out, bringing out the true beauty of this anime.
However, the "bubbly shoujo background" is used WAY too often.
Sound-(Rate-7)
The soundtrack serves it purpose, but is surprisingly good.
It's peaceful to say the least. Also, the openings are really good.
The japanesedub is EXCELLENT and no english dub is needed in my opinion.\n\n
Characters-(Rate-10)\n\n
Stereotypical? Yes.\n
Unlikable? No.\n
Being the best part of this show, I fell in love with every character this series\n
had to offer. I felt like Raku had very strong bonds with each of the girls, which\n
is very important in a romance anime in my opinion. Now as for my "best girl",\n
I had a hard time picking. But in the end, I'm tied with Chitoge and Seishirou. \n
I love tsunderes, so Chitoge was right up my alley and Seishirou was so badass,\n
yet so cute, so I couldn't stop loving her. As for Marika and Kosaki, I found Marika\n
very annoying, yet surprisingly funny and Kosaki very charming.\n\n
Enjoyment-(Rate-10)\n\n
This series had me laughing really hard a lot\n
and I truly loved every single moment of this anime.\n
It's not the best romance anime to date, but it's one\n
of my favorites out of pure enjoyment.\n\n
Pros-\n\n
-lovable characters\n
-vivid animation\n
-catchy opening\n
-superb voice acting\n
-really funny\n\n
Cons-\n\n
-lackluster ending\n
-interrupted character development\n
-repetition of some jokes got too old\n
-BUBBLY SHOUJO BACKGROUND IS USED WAY TOO OFTEN\n
-Marika was really annoying\n
-Where's my season 3?\n\n
Rate Overall- 8.6 (Rounded to a 9)

Let me just say this: This is my first review, and I hope all of you enjoy this review as much as I enjoyed this anime.
Stop what you're doing right now and start watching this anime. I'm by no means a harem fan, but this is the sole exception. The reason is that one of my favorite animation studios; SHAFT, made this. I was expecting something completely dialogue-heavy with complex humor, and outright random art-style like the monogatari series, however that is not the case. First off,
The Story:Overall Rating: 8

The story is by no means original. However, that doesn't make it unenjoyable. Basically, it's boy meets girl ten years ago, boy  get's a locket and girl get's key, they get separated by boy moving. The whole anime is about who gave the boy the locket and who has the key, and basically most of the girls he meets have a key and it's a mystery about who has it. One downside is that the story has little to no plot progression, but it still has more than the sequel which is basically filler. *spoiler* by the end of the anime, it's still undecided who gave the boy the locket *end spoiler* Anyway, time to go onto the art.


The Art:                                                     Overall Rating: 10

The art style in this anime is simply fantastic, and I don't have any complaints about it. It's bright and cheery, and I would expect nothing less from SHAFT.


The Sound:                                                Overall Rating: 8

The opening and ending soundtrack is very enjoyable, but didn't really pop out to me in any way other than that they are beautiful.


Characters:                                                Overall Rating: 10

The character designs and personalities are all really enjoyable, and they all make for some hilarious moments. Chitoge is best girl, and *spoiler* Raku realizes this in the manga *end spoiler*


Enjoyment:   10/10

I seriously enjoyed this anime. I dislike harem anime, yet this somehow made me fall in love with the series. I recommend it to everybody.


Don't let anyone else fool you, Chitoge is best girl and everybody knows it.

Nisekoi
Art: As a rule I tend to shy away from things art styles that focus on over-the-top features, but while Niskekoi didn’t have a lot of that, every single character had a unique feature that was well explained and at no point was I trying to figure out why Chitoge always has the ribbon, or why Tachibana has such long hair. Each character was more than just a change of clothes or hair but had different facial features and structures. Sure they are a bit similar but that is just keeping consistency. Another interesting thing was the architecture of the school! It was really uniqueand the intricacies really made me fall in love with the atmosphere of the show overall. If I really worked hard to try and figure out something I didn’t really care for, it would probably be the blue hair of Ichijo (The male lead). In a world where the hair colors are pretty consistent, this just gave me a feeling of inconsistency. But this minuscule detail didn’t stop me from absolutely loving this art. 


Sound/Music: I found that the music was more akin to background noise at times. I felt that the introduction animations were funny and showed a lot of charm, working well with the music, but I didn’t really have a problem skipping past the ending sequences. However, as the story began to progress, I feel like the music played a better role in communicating emotions that we were seeing a character portray, but the music takes it to the next step by trying to get us, the viewer, to feel the same emotion that the character is feeling. That kind of sound direction is what separates a good show from a great show. As for the sound, there wasn’t much variation outside of the occasional punch or slap. It would have been nice to hear things like footsteps when it needs to be dramatic, or heavy breathing when a nervous moment comes up. 


Story: Season One- I feel like the story was really well put together in the first season. Two kids who only have just met, pushed into a relationship that is just for show, how awkward! Not only that, the main, Ichijo is in love with another girl, and because of this false relationship he can’t pursue Onodera the way he wants to! Not only that he has this mysterious locket that he got 10 years prior after making a promise to someone, but he can’t remember the promise or what the locket holds. It isn’t super original, but the way that it is a mix of Romeo and Juliet (kind of and they even make reference to this in the show) and ‘What’s in the Locket?’ creates a show that is fun to watch and easy to get invested in. I won’t spoil anything, but things get pretty complicated and Ichijo has to deal with a lot of extra stuff just to keep everyone happy! Season Two - I am including season two in this review because it is largely the same in many aspects but the major difference here is there is no real defined plot, but rather the plot will vary based on the episode. We meet a few new characters and most of them go undeveloped, save for Oondera’s little sister, It is a nice continuation of the story that after a single season I was hungry for more. I must say that I could see myself watching this show for a lot longer if that is the direction they choose to take, the characters are just that likable. 


Personal Reflection: I really really enjoyed this show. It didn’t take long for me to fall in love with this cast and that is probably why it got so popular. I must say that for the girls that seem to really want to be with Ichijo, I root for Chitoge over all others, and I know that probably isn’t the popular opinion, because Ichijo and Onodera would be so cute, or even Ichijo and Tsugumi would be fun, but I just see the main two as a better couple. As I said in my art section the architecture of the school was just so cool! The openness and the artistic fence design around the pool, I just couldn’t get enough of it. Really, I wish my university would have those kind of open air buildings, however I live in the Midwestern United States and it snows all the time here so maybe not the best idea, but still! I have to say, this show really put me in a good place. I loved being able to come back to it after a long day or have a break and just watch an episode or two, and just enjoy the great story and characters. While I don’t love the way it ended, and there are questions that have been left unanswered, I am only hoping for another season! Fingers Crossed. If you love shows about people that are overly caring about putting others before themselves and girls that are all eccentric and fun, you will love Nisekoi! 


Overall Score: 9.8/10

Nisekoi is just one of those genres of animes that we've all seen and loved. The goofy yet lovable male lead, with various types of girls surrounding him that actually have personality, making this something of a harem, but with much more comedy and respect for women in general. It's silly and easy to watch with fun visuals. That being said, the animation it a bit limited, but that's definitely an artistic choice.
Our protagonist, Ichijo, is a reliable high school boy that cooks, likes taking care of others, and is a bit shy at times, constantly being thrown into rather inconvenient situations, thanks to hisfamily (the yakuza) and the people he surrounds himself with (multiple girls and one comedic male friend). The animation style is similar to Bakemonogatari (as it is also produced by Aniplex and SHAFT), giving the overall look a simple but creative twist.\n
Overall, I enjoyed the story. It was fairly predictable, but it's the predictability that comforts us, and in spite of that, it still made me laugh. If you want a nice light anime, this is a good choice for you. Things never get all that "heavy" or "deep" in this anime, and if you like the comedy of not simply a love triangle, but a love pentagon of sorts, then again, this could be a nice option. The series first teases you with the mystery of a locket and the key to a promise, and as the story goes on things just keep getting more and more mixed up.\n
I enjoyed the simplicity of the story. It's a nice way to wind down. Simple as that.\n
I'm also a sucker for voice actors and I absolutely loved all the voice acting in this anime. Very fun and vibrant with lots of creative shouting. Hard to explain, but there it is.\n
The final episode to me was very...lacking. It was definitely one of those endings that just drop. No promises of a second season, and no hints as to what might happen next. It seemed more like one of the random middle episodes than a grand finale, so, be warned of that.

eapp2017
nisekoi or in english "false love", an anime that is about a son of a yakuza gang is enganged to a foreign daughter of a mafia gang in order to make them keep at peace. 
	The story wasn't the main strength of this anime, it just shows the cliched dramas from childhood promises, to school and family matters, absurd mishaps and misunderstandings, which audiences wasn't expecting it to be about. In my opinion the story is quite not believable, it seems it is too much "not natural" at some point because of certain conditions mainly because that it this is an harem anime. Plus thestory is getting nowhere as you progess through the show it just is like that, that is the main  purpose of the show, to not emphasize the gang war but rather the daily lives of the relationships of the protagonists.


	Typically there is nothing really action happening in highschool romcoms so the expected art was really unexpected, the art  really impressive. the animators where just able to pull great visuals on the characters, the environment and the things that they are interacting with (eg. food). The art was very colorful and pleasant, yes they encorporate a lot of sparkly stuff and it was not that bland because other highschool animes it's not as colorful an appealing rather dark environment (eg. Say I Love You). They were able to emphasize the characters' emotions and feeling though the changing the art of the background, also the character design was spot on for each an every character. They were able to animate what they are really need to do as it says in the manga with some exaggeration (eg. jumping from the 2nd floor of the building), which for me is not a dissapointment because people always hate it when a adaptaion of a book turns into a film. Of all that in art i would give this anime a solid 10/10, from the sparkling, shimmering that the always put to make it more lively and colorful to the characters' form (eg. chibi form).    	


	The characters, I loved them. Even though the story was cliched, what I like about this anime is its' characters. From the faces to the attitudes, this anime showed what it needs to show. I just love Onodera as she blushes, being flustered or just straight up being happy. I love her to the point that I keep a framed picture of her in my room. All those aside even though I hate Chitoge due to her attitude, she is just she needs to be or this show would not be Nisekoi. Every character is important for the story to progress, even though the story is getting nowhere. The side characters is also wee done even though they have a minor role in th show. The tsundere main girl? Check, the cute chilhood good girl? Check, the dense main guy? Check, that annoying friend who gets his butt kicked in every episode? Check. There is no character that is not needed in this show to make this show as funny and very lovable as it possibly as it can be. 


	A good anime needs a  good soundtrack and nisekoi did not fail the audiences on providing that. The intro song was really flowy, very cathcy I really like on how songs to make the anime more romcom-ish rather just a normal romcom anime. The background music is superb, there was never a dead air scene and the music is really appropriate for the scene, example when Onodera greets Raku and then Raku blushes like a tomato, with all the sparkly effects, the music made the scene more loveable, enjoyable and complete. Another example, when in some cases drama shows up the music is able to amplify the feelings that the audience feel, it made it more heavier rather if there is no music. The music was great, especially the BGMs and the intro. Another thing that made the music great was the outro songs, it was unique because majority of animes the outro is just  the same all season long but in this show the song changes with a recpective character as the center of that songs and i personally like it that way so I won't skip the outro song every episode.


	Overall this anime for me is a different but cliched anime, very enjoyable especially for people seeking a romcom genre and really funny anime. The enjoyment factor was so high that you will watch the entire season for just one-sitting like I did and needless to say this anime is raging wars on the internet whether who is the best girl in the anime and if you want to get involve then watch this one. It's not groundbreaking or life changing but it has proven one thing: you need to defend your waifu on those people who are against her. #Nisekoi #EAPP2017 #Onodera4waifu

Many people bash and criticize Nisekoi, but I don't hate it. That being said I also don't love it or do I see what all the hype was about. To me Nisekoi was good. I'm currently watching this in 2017 and to be honest, Nisekoi can stand ground with some anime this year. The art is beautiful and very unique. However the sound and music was meh. The story should of progressed a bit more faster and the characters were just the normal anime character types. All that being said, I did enjoy the anime a lot. If you like light hearted comedies and sliceof life's then I would recommend this to you. However if you want more of a romcom I would suggest you trying it out.

Disclaimer: Review may contain spoilers for Season 2 and the Manga!!!
If you have a hobby of listening to “intellectual” people on the internet, then you’ve likely picked up on the fact that tropes aren’t a very popular concept among the populace. Typically, overused tropes have a habit of making stories with fascinating premises into something very predictable. They turn characters that could have been multidimensional into entities that lack any sense of growth or development. On rare occasions, however, a talented writer could take stale and overused tropes and wring more enjoyment out of them than one could even begin to comprehend. Nisekoi is afine example of this duality of trope usage, a duality of the majesty of its perfectly executed tropes and the deluge of mediocrity that it would eventually call home.


Story


The premise of Nisekoi is probably the most important aspect of its story. The story begins with our protagonist Raku Ichijou finding out that he has to pretend to be in a fake relationship with a girl of his father’s choosing. You see, Raku is the son of a yakuza boss and since his (surprisingly lax) yakuza dad isn’t very good at keeping his boys from picking fights with a nearby American gang, the only rational decision is to force his son to martyr this mess back into shape. This is problematic for Raku as he already has a girl in school that he really likes (though lacks the stones to let her know his feelings and the awareness to realize that the feelings are mutual) and the girl that he has to play pretend with is a violent tsundere that hates his guts, because their first ever meeting was less than stellar.


This setup, however, quickly takes a backseat with the introduction of Raku’s keyhole pendant which he claims he received from a girl when he was very young. He and said girl made a promise to reunite and maybe get married and be in love forever. Conveniently, Raku has no recollection of any faces or names from this event and all of the girls related to said event that turn up over the course of this series are “seemingly” just as clueless. And with this, the harem anime sets itself up for some “tropey” goodness. 


The reason I said that the initial premise is important is because the story is essentially a near endless regurgitation of these two premises, constantly repeating itself like a broken record. This is barely noticeable in the 1st season, because of the emphasis on introducing the main characters and establishing Chitoge’s feelings. As you move on to the rest of the series, however, you will find an overwhelmingly staggering amount of filler that does nothing to move the story from its standstill. Oh look, Tsugumi found another random spy device that makes her have to be close to Raku. Oh look, Tachibana found a way to rope him into spending more time with her. Oh look, it’s another festival and/or another school club/event that may or may not have already happened during the previous school year. Every iteration of these moments ends up feeling longer and emptier as the show adds more auxiliary characters that it has to forcefully involve in every scene. This continues until the last few chapter of the manga, which I can only describe as dramatic, yet strangely empty. As someone whose “best girl” ends up being chosen in the end, I was still left feeling very unsatisfied by the ending of this series.


Characters


	Raku is the epitome of the bland harem protagonist. He’s an extremely nice guy, willing to go above and beyond to help a stranger in need, especially if that stranger can be added into his harem afterwards. He’s exceptionally average in both sports and academics so as not to overshadow any of the girls who excel, while also always being there for the girls that don’t. In true shounen fashion, however, this does not stop him from breaking expectation if the plot calls for it. He has no outlandish sense of fashion that might scare the girls off, instead opting for the safe and highly sought-after school uniform/ white shirt and pants. The only things that really make him stand out are his enormous necklace and the unexplained hair clip in his messy bed hair.


	Though bland, Raku can actually be mistaken for an interesting and multidimensional character whenever he has to interact with Chitoge. This is because, unlike the rest of the harem cast, Raku’s attitude towards Chitoge fluctuates wildly throughout the series, leaving each interaction much less predictable than with the rest of the cast. Towards the end of the series, this was the main aspect that kept me somewhat invested in his character as it’s the only aspect of it that felt somewhat grounded in reality. His nice guy status begins to feel somewhat forced and unrealistic when he walks away smiling from a forced gang infiltration mission, being stranded on a deserted island, and taking on multiple mafia gangs by himself, all because of “friendship” or “because why not?”


	Chitoge is one of the main love interests for Raku and is introduced as the daughter of a rival gang that Raku has to appease by forming a fake relationship with her. Though Chitoge can be described as just another tsudere, I believe her to be one of the most, if not the most, developed characters in this series. Her main appeal is the very fact that she is an incredibly flawed person. Her uncertain past and problematic relationship with her family has left her to being pretty clueless as to how to interact with people. This makes her constantly waver between trying to be polite and friendly, whilst trying to keep her brash and antagonistic side from rearing its ugly head and screwing up everything for her.  Initially she can come off as extremely unlikeable, but as the series moves on and she begins to learn how to better handle her internal turmoil, she becomes better at reining in her aggressive and standoffish side. It also helps that she is one of the few girls that aren’t immediately in love with the protagonist, as the events that lead her up to that revelation are actually quite humorous, jaw-dropping, and heart-warming.


	Onodera is the other main love interest for Raku and is introduced as a long time classmate and crush of our protagonist. Though she herself has shared this sentiment since the two were in middle school, Onodera can’t confess these feelings because she suffers from an extreme form of shyness known only as Dandere. Instead she tries to slowly win over Raku with her overwhelming cuteness and sweetness, and that’s an understatement. Onodera is, quite possibly, the very manifestation of sweetness. Just about every scene, in which she is prominently featured, will force a smile to creep across your face.  Unlike Chitoge, her flaws aren’t offensive and aggravating, but are rather quirks that enhance her natural sweetness. She’s shy, but not to the point where she can’t make friends or be sociable. She’s not very smart, but not to the degree that she feels like a moron who needs her hand held through everything. She can’t cook, but has a hidden strength that still lets her shine and compliment Raku’s mastery of the kitchen. Though she lacks any real growth or development beyond her slowly mustering up her courage over the span of way too many chapters/episodes, she is a very likeable character and easily understandable favorite for a huge chunk of the audience.


	Those three are the pillars upon which this show stands and I don’t think it will be very “spoilery” to say that none of the other girls introduced throughout this series have a sliver of a chance at coming out on top against those two archetypal behemoths. Regardless, I will very briefly run through who they are and my opinion of them. 


Tsugumi is Chitoge’s bodyguard and is initially introduced as a double agent with the mission to uncover the falsehood of her relationship with Raku. Though she develops feelings for the boy in time, she does her best to cast them aside and aid Chitoge in her ventures. The conflicting nature of her personal and professional position was an interesting idea, but the series does nothing with it that is of note. She herself, while fine and likeable, is very predictable and this gets rather repetitive.


Tachibana is quite possibly the worst character in the series and the first nail in the coffin that is Nisekoi. She is extremely aggressive with her pursuit of Raku, often forcing herself into scenes seemingly out of nowhere as she screams “Rakuuuu-samaaaa!!!!!!” She is loud, obnoxious, needy, rude, and thirsty as hell. The show tries to make her likeable by making her suddenly turn shy when her cringe worthy tactics actually work (because that makes sense) and by being extremely sickly and frail in every other scene, but the above. It’s a cheap attempt at forcing the audience to care about such a repulsive character and it only gets worse the further you go.


Haru is the little sister character and spends the vast majority of the series being very misguided about her choices in love. Yui is the older sister character and spends her short time with the series being very overconfident about her capabilities and very oblivious of her impending rejection. Both are introduced to seemingly draw out the length of this series as I honestly can’t think of any ways that these characters contributed to the story. Technically Haru helps Onodera with her pursuit of Raku, but technically Ruri already does that. Technically Yui holds a piece of information about Raku’s past, but technically so does Tachibana, his dad, and seemingly every other adult in this universe. Gutting these two characters would have done wonders for the pacing of this series, in my opinion.


There are also some reoccurring side characters that appear throughout the series, but the only ones worth even mentioning are the best friends of Raku and Onodera, Maiko and Ruri respectively. Maiko is a lovable goofball/pervert with a secret and “mature” passion, as well as a heart of gold. Ruri is the no nonsense smart girl with a penchant for comedically-timed death stares. Both are fairly entertaining characters that get a little arc dedicated to each of them.


Overall


	Despite the harshness with which I’ve approached the series, I do absolutely adore the 1st season of it. The best that Nisekoi has to offer to its viewers is frontloaded into that first quarter of the story. That, combined with Shaft’s general style of producing anime, results in an absolute treat for anyone willing to just have fun and not think or expect too much. The same can be said for the 2nd season as well, though to a lesser extent as that is where the filler starts to crop up. It is, at least, worth watching if you’ve enjoyed the 1st season.


If after all of that, you are still interested in seeing the story through, I highly recommend looking up the online chart that tells you which chapters of the manga can be skipped. There will be a lot of questionable content in the manga even without the filler, but I imagine that it will be much less painful of an experience. That said, it should be clear who the “winner” is going to be by the end of the 1st season and the finale isn’t particularly stimulating, so skipping the manga altogether is a plausible decision as well. For me, the manga was a massive disappointment of mind-numbingly boring proportions and I can’t stress enough the caution with which one should approach it.

Nisekoi suffers a few smaller, fatal flaws that altogether ruin my enjoyment of it. I know that Nisekoi has a large following on this site but just know in advance that my opinions of this piece do not represent a particular active dislike of this anime or it's fans, just why it isn't for me and why like-minded people may not enjoy it.
Let me start off with the good things about it: It has a very nice art style and sound design and I can tell a lot of work went in to make this aesthetically pleasing, however, this is about the extent ofmy enjoyment of this particular anime. I will say however that the art is of very, very  high quality and is amazing if you're someone who enjoys anime which are very colorful and have an atypical art style.


My main problem with Nisekoi is that the main character is incredibly unintelligent, to the point where it was sometimes painful to watch him make such poor choices and ignore such obvious answers to his own inquiry. If you are the kind of person who finds themselves yelling at their screen when characters ignore the obvious or make unfounded conclusions then Nisekoi will probably damage your vocal chords.


At the end of the day, Nisekoi is neither here nor there when it comes to quality. It's a story that's been done before a million times, and unless you like the specific type of story being presented it might be worth passing on this one, because the characters just weren't memorable for me. They fit archetypes that have been done before and you can pretty much predict their lines in advance if you've seen a lot of comedies or harem anime.  Nobody really "stood out" to me and no scenes stood out as particularly memorable.


If you don't mind the above and just want another comedic harem anime then you may enjoy this. I just didn't find myself able to get invested in it at all and often times it lost my attention completely.

One of the best romantic comedies I've ever seen. It has everything. Drawings, soundtrack, story, characters, humor. If I think I can not find anything that I liked more. Surely it is a harem, but two of the four protagonists are almost always in the background, to complete the scene or to make more or less serious interludes. And this is what I love, a well-defined triangle in which feelings are clear, but at the same time evolving. The protagonist is not the usual stupid that do not understand anything, but it's the perfect mix of innocence and romance that makes nisekoi an absolute gem.Onodera, Kirisaki and Tachibana are fantastic, I still can not decide who to root for. Speaking of drawings, personally I find them really well done. Excellent soundtrack, but the closing theme songs, are exceptional. I see no reason not to laugh and get excited with Nisekoi. Highly Recommended.






168/5000

Bobduh (certain narrative connoisseur) dropped it right away and claims the writing is crap, so just to get that out of the way. Now for my take on it (and hell if I'm not bigger expert than him in this particular subgenre!). What's great about this? Visual design of characters and especially their expressions, the background art which has just the right amount of shaft added to it, the Shinbo direction, and hence the perfect pacing and punctual humor. Seriously, I laughed out loud pretty much every single episode, often multiple times per episode. So this can get compared with shows such as Sakurasou orToradora, as it's a rom com with one guy and 2+ girls. So harem undertone, while not really being a harem. Except Nisekoi later departs from that and falls more in line with general harems. 


But unlike mentioned, Nisekoi focuses on the comedy element, while downplaying drama and romance. That's not to say drama and romance aren't there or important, it's just that it's more about humor instead. And I think it even uses that to justify it's lack of progress and bad writing in romance and drama departments. 


And for a time it's all good, it's really funny and you just keep counting how many times drama and romance got thrown under a bus to maintain the status quo while covering it up with humor and just a little bit of perceived progression. And in the first half, it really feels like there is progression, even though for every two steps forward we keep taking one step back and then also sidetracking for a bit. In the second half however, the amount of time some random shit excuses the progression just to maintain status quo just gets old and no longer something that's easily forgivable. 


Manga is still ongoing so at least saying this isn't technically a spoiler: Writing feels biased towards a particular girl, and if that's the girl you're cheering on, and you're just here for some humor, pretty visuals and emotional fanservice, then more power to you, and you'll probably love this show if you aren't bothered by cheesy writing. It might make you realise how good Sakurasou actually is when it comes to actually having themes and drama! Bashing continues in spoilers section: 


SPOILERS AHEAD:


This show is written completely in favor of Chitoge. Most of the moments shared between Onodera and Raku come about from Onodera mustering up her courage to ask him for something, and there isn't any conflict to build chemistry from. Instead there's a lot of romantic tension which gets misinterpreted because they're not supposed to like each other. On the other hand, whenever there's a crisis, Raku always resolves it by dashing to Chitoge. All his agency is directed towards showing Chitoge that he cares. Raku and Onodera will never have any chance to have a genuine emotional connection, while Chitoge get generous helpings every episode.


What bothers me most is I know how it's gonna end and there's no suspense. The show is basically: watch as we tease Onodera and slowly ruin her dreams of ever being with Raku, while Chitoge achingly slowly learns to be honest with herself. And that becomes more and more apparent as the show goes on, making me as an Onodera fan, more and more unable to enjoy the show at all, even though I found the first 5 or so episodes supremely entertaining, and whole first half generally quite enjoyable. By the time of last two episodes, I found it borderline unwatchable. I don't think I'll be picking up the sequel in any form. The way show is now treating Onodera is just too painful to watch. 


Edit: I bumped this up to 7 and picked up the second season. Yes ladies and gentlemen you just witnessed someone on the internet change their mind. It comes down to expectations really. Once you make peace with this being an eternal tease where nothing ever progresses, it's possible to detach from romantic drama and enjoy it for its humor, craziness and cute girls, where it excels!

Nisekoi, a story about how Shaft can continually deliver an experience that proves production value is not an issue when you want to deliver something absolutely magnificent.
Well if you're reading this review, you should know what the show is about based off of the official synopsis.
Story: The show doesn't deliver a breath-taking or exhilarating story that'll change your mind about the main theme. That being said, it does what it has set out to do- Be a romantic comedy. It doesn't overstep its bounds or tries to be a uniquely themed romcom. This is where it stands strong enough to appeal to the general audiencewith the tease of each girl and the antics that ensue with each singular arc.


Art: What can I say? If you're a Shaft fan or if you've read the original source, you'd know what to expect based off of the original art style that works in tandem with Shaft iconic landmark animation. If anything, this is definitely the strongest part of the show if not the signature Shaft head tilts.


Sound: From packing a load of silly sound effects with each episode to the catchy and very appropriate soundtrack to the unbelievably popular openings done by ClariS who also sang the openings for Madoka Magica, it's no wonder why Nisekoi in the sound department did not disappoint. While it isn't on Kill la Kill or Attack on Titan level of awesome, this anime delivers plenty enough.


Character: Each character has been built with a quite noticeable stereotype. This is probably the weakest part of the show because most characters do not break out of their own shell. The other side of the coin is none of the main characters ever shy away from screen time and the side characters are not one bit forgettable. All around the cast of characters is small enough for the show to concentrate on and not have to worry about who gets the limelight.


Enjoyment: Honestly, this show is one to be watched more than once for its divine comedy. You give Shaft a show like this and they can really execute how the show is done. Between the fan service and the romance, all characters despite their cliche upbringings, bring a level of excitement and seriousness that ultimately balances out.


Overall: Given how well this show has done and the fact that this isn't the perfect show, it delivers on a level that has got me saying- "This is a must watch." Between the fabulous voice acting of all the memorable voice actors and their quirky personality and unique art style that carried the show, it is enough to earn a overall score of 9/10.

(Nisekoi SEASON 1 Review)

My anime Review of: Nisekoi! (Note: this is my first time reviewing so if I missed anything important, I apologize in advance)
Story-5.7
It’s just simple! 2 Families are fighting! In order to Stop it, the son/daughter of the 2 Gangs have to fake dating each other! Hence the title “Nisekoi”. But there’s one catch. They don’t like each other! Thus the beginning of a generic Rom-Com anime! Seriously? They have to fake date each other in order to stop the fighting? There are more EASIER ways to solve that! The 2 Boss of the gangs don’t want to fight but their men hate each other thatmuch that they don’t obey their boss? Really? And the only way to solve this is for the son/daughter of the 2 boss has to be in a fake relationship? That Totally Makes Sense. And about the key thing. I think it’s just an excuse for the harem to happen.But they did one thing in the story right. The Phasing. The Phasing of this anime is well executed. And I like when instead of making it 23 or a 24 episode anime, they made it 20 instead. They knew that they couldn’t Prolong the Anime more because they might fuck shit up. That or Shaft just got tired animating it. Other than that, I really have nothing to say anymore.   


Characters-8

Yes! Another Dense Main Character! Well, he isn’t really that dense but…… Another Dense Main Character! Moving on. The characters are really likeable. Although they’re all a little bit generic. Just a little bit. All of the characters’  development is….. meh. By far the weakest one is Marika. She has little screen time and development. I wish we could’ve explored her a bit more. I got to give props for the supporting characters. They did a great job. How about Raku and Chitoge you ask? The Main Protagonist and the Main Female Lead? No DOUBT, ONE OF THE BEST anime couples I have ever seen. Their chemistry is just so good. TeamChitoge All the way!. The characters were the key factor to this anime. Good job Characters


Music-7.5

The openings are the type of “It’s good but nothing more”. How about the ending songs? Man, they have a lot of ending songs. My personal favorite one is Recover Decoration because Bitch it’s KAWAII. They all have different ending songs for different characters. And I really have to give Shaft props for the Animation. The using of different bright colors and shapes. It’s just amazing. The soundtrack are good. Nothing much to say. Over all, the music in this anime is Good. Nothing more, nothing less.


Animation-8.5

As you have may known, This was animated by Shaft. And Shaft has never ceased to disappoint me. Not until Mekaku City Actors came along. The animation was gorgeous. Using of different styles and colorings. It’s just wonderful to the eyes. The animation itself is fairly average compared to the animes this time year. But they style is what it makes it beautiful. And off course, It’s not shaft if there’s no Legendary Head Tilt.   


Personal Enjoyment-9

I Enjoyed The Fuck out of Nisekoi When it was in its first weeks. I stopped it because I got bored of it. After watching it again and finishing it. I still enjoyed it.  


Overall Score-7.74

It is not something amazing. In the end it is just another Romance, Comedy, Harem anime. And what does romance, comedy, harem anime does best? Is to make your day happy (And in some cases, make you have a boner) And I couldn't wish for anything better

Nisekoi is a twenty episode anime centred on the life of Raku Ichijo who is the son of a Mafia leader. Due to tensions between a rival gang Raku is forced to stage a relationship with the opposing Mafia leaders’ daughter Chitoge Kirisaki. Thus begins the awkward façade whilst he pursues his actual crush Kosaki Onodera, deals with Chitoge’s overly violent and love stricken bodyguard Seishiro Tsugumi and the forced fiancé Marika Tachibana.
I initially started to watch this show upon its release back in January 2014. I had decided to put this on hold after being less than impressed with it due to the TsundereChitoge who was a consistent thorn in my side up until episode six. Come the end of the show, Chitoge was still a major hindrance rendering the show further un-enjoyable for me. The main protagonist certainly didn't help matters with his obliviousness to realize that Onodera has feelings for him.


Story:


The story revolves around Raku Ichijo the son of a Mafia leader who enjoys his normal high school life despite his unusual upbringings around many gang members. On the way to school he is kicked in the face by a blonde transfer student Chitoge Kirisaki who would later in turn be forced into a fake relationship with Raku in order to stop the violence between the two gangs much to both parties dismay.


The two then go about putting on a front for the rest of the series in front of the gang members and school students alike.


The story is frankly not great. Throwing the two into a no win situation where they have to be together for lengthy periods of time when they don’t necessarily get along makes for bad comedy at times. Chitoge’s Tsundere act is quite annoying as she only throws anger at the direction of Raku despite his efforts to be nice and help her out on multiple occasions. Other comedy elements stem from misunderstandings which is horribly distasteful and the best friend Shu Maiko who does well on his part for the show being the most rational yet comedic trouble maker.


Characters:


Raku Ichijo is your standard guy. He just wants to live peacefully without the hassle of Mafia breathing down on him. He has a long time crush on Onodera which is sweet and all, but his inability to realize that Onodera has feeling for him infuriates me. I remember at the beginning when Raku didn't notice a substantial clue about his childhood sweetheart which was so blatantly obvious that I questioned how he can be so completely oblivious to the matter. I hate how he cannot make up his mind as to which girl he is in love with. Raku states Onodera, but his relationship progression with others would just tell you he is indecisive.


Chitoge Kirisaki is the main lead who in general can be a bitch at times. Coming back from America Chitoge is introduced and initially struggles to read Kanji amongst having a hard time making friends. Despite Raku’s dislike of her he does his utmost to help her study and make friends. Chitoge does have her moments of kindness, but it is usually thwarted by her embarrassment to admit she is wrong or thank Raku for his help. I personally wouldn't root for her in pursuit of Raku.


Kosaki Onodera is our second competitor for Raku’s heart. Onodera is a sweet and very shy girl and close friend to Raku. She has a hard time putting her feelings out towards Raku which is difficult to understand as it is painfully obvious to see. I like when she and Raku spend time together as it is very awkward but sweet to watch. The episode in which they are together at Onodera’s shop is a nice bonding episode, but in all fails to amount to any substantial development in their relationship, its as if they are as they started.


Other mentionable characters include the comedic and perverted best friend Shu Maiko who seems to be one of few people who knows what’s going on behind the scenes. Next is Seishiro Tsugumi who is a violent bodyguard for Chitoge, who can have her cute side. Lastly is Marika Tachibana the elegant lady who reformed her strange accent in order to be Raku’s ideal girl.


Art:


The artwork was well done; it had a good variety of colour and lighting which made it good to look at. The character designs were nothing spectacular just clean cut, cute girls. Animation was ok I hate when it uses the cliché tropes such as blushing faces and drastic change in the characters designs to fit comedic and awkward situations in this scenario I wasn't pleased.


Sound:


The few soundtracks that I managed to find on-line were very decent actually and a little quirky, much better off accommodated in a more comedic anime. The use of guitar and piano was very good. 


Final Verdict:


Overall I had a hard time with this show. It sums up why I dropped it in the first place. While the show has its moments with comedy and a fraction of development with Raku and the females, ultimately it fails to justify the lengthy time spent watching it. This is the sort of show you shout at the protagonist to make up his mind, becoming much more commonplace these days.


If you hate rom-coms with little to no progress I suggest you steer clear. No characters are worth sticking around for and no episodes really stuck out to me.


Overall I give Nisekoi a low 6 out of 10 


I suggest giving it four episodes to see if it sways you.


Alternate recommendation is Highschool DxD a harem with an indecisive main character, but this centres around supernatural circumstances.

When you promised to your childhood sweetheart that you don't clearly remember that you'll marry each other someday by unlocking a locket, will you still fulfill it even if you are in a relationship? How about a fake relationship?
Nisekoi or False Love is just another cliche animes right there. Its all about promises, girls that are involve to a guy's harem, the guy being oblivious to his crush's feelings for him and fake relationship. What can you expect? Raku Ichijou, a yakuza's father son is forced to have relationship to a rival gang's daughter, Chitoge Kirisaki to avoid war between the two for 3 years.They have this 'hate at first sight' relationship. How can they manage their relationship if his classmate-ex-crush Kosaki Onodera (who likes him too but can't manage to confess her feelings for him) is aware to their relationship? What if everyone finds that out? And what if there would be intruders to their relationship?


Just because this anime is cliche doesn't means that I don't like it. For a romantic comedy anime, SHAFT managed this one. Who remembers Bean Sprout and Gorilla?  Shaft did a great job to this one and their phenomenal head tilts are here. If you want rom-com shows, give this one a try. 7/10


Oh what can I say about the art? Fantastic! The animation is vivid and colorful with a taste of slow motion techniques in some scenes. Like what I said, thank you Shaft for animating this one, although it was surprising, you didn't disappoint me. 10/10


The sounds. The OST's are decent and both OP and ED are great. The two Openings (CLICK and STEP) by ClariS are both and very suitable for the series and the ending themes, I personally liked Heart Pattern (by Nao Touyama a.k.a Chitoge) and Hanagonomi (by Kana Asumi a.k.a Marika Tachibana) the other two are also good too, its a pleasure to hear them all.


The voice acting, I thought that Kana Hanazawa did a great job for voicing Onodera. Also, Nao Touyama delivered well Chitoge's tsun-tsun personality and Kana Asumi for Marika's sweet but scary voice. I can't remember clearly Raku and Tsugumi's voice and others but they did a great job and one that stood out in my ears is Yuki Kaji in his pervert role (again) to Shu Maiko. 9/10


Most of the characters didn't developed that well in my opinion.


Raku Ichijou. Always expect to a harem show that the main guy is dense and true indeed to this guy. He may be a jerk often times but he is a jerk with a heart of gold.


Chitoge Kirisaki. Many male viewers hate her for her tsundere personality but the truth is she is just a innocent girl that doesn't know a lot of things about love and she just express her feelings in a violent way. She had the biggest character development throughout the entire series.


Kosaki Onodera. Completely opposite of Chitoge as many male viewers find her cute and charming. She is just like Raku that is oblivious to his feelings for her but somehow she's a girl that will inspire you.


Tsugumi Seishirou. Another tsundere character that is in denial to her true feelings. Because her appearance is becoming lesser as the shows goes by, her development is weak.


Marika Tachibana. Your sweet and classic girl that is expressive to her feelings but the truth is she is fragile and scary inside. But still, you will like her. 9/10


I enjoyed this anime a lot though the characters didn't had the development that I wanted and also, this may be irrelevant to the story but the Paper Plane in the OP sequence... I remembered its manga's one-shot story. Just sayin'


Overall, Nisekoi is focused on how relationship grows and how you relate your self by the characters here. If you noticed grammar mistakes here, just let met know because I can't calm when I'm typing this. Anyways, again if you love romantic comedy animes that is wrapped in an harem anime, give this one a shot, because the episodes will sure surprise you. 8/10

This anime is not that great, enjoyable at best but the whole delaying the plot thing is something overused on anime's nowadays that it makes any new anime that uses that become mediocre...
The "plot" is about this guy who is entering high school and has this pendant with a lock, the anime makes it look at first like he was given the pendant by a girl 10 years previous the anime and that she would keep the key and once they reunite again they would marry...
As he is the son of a Yakuza mafia boss he is respected by the members of the group, butanother mafia the Bee Hive Gang came and started trouble, as they were about to go to an all out war his father and the leader of the Bee Hive Gang decided that the best course of action is to have both their child date for the recurring 3 years of high school...\n
A 3 year of the daughter's leader of the Bee Hive Gang and the son of the Yakuza mafia boss to fake a relationship, as they meet they start to hate and not even able to stand each other...\n
It is even more complicated when Raku the Yakuza Boss's son is in love with another girl Kosaki whom he has not declared to in the entire fucking series...\n
To complicate things even more the one holding the key is supposed to be Kosaki herself, but what do you know? Chitoge the Bee Hive Gang boss's daughter has also a key and Raku was told by the Bee Hive Gang boss that he, Kosaki and Chitoge used to play 10 years ago when they were kid both have a memory of being promised something by a guy around that time...\n
To fuck things a notch the daughter of the Chief of police is apparently the fiance promised by Raku's father to the Chief, and yes you guessed it 10 years ago around the same time and to even further it she also has a key of a promised being made to her apparently by Raku...\n
To that point the story seemed fine and good but as they kept the story going they just seem to avoid using the main story and begin doing secondary stuff...\n
This anime had great potential but i doubt we'll see a 3rd season...\n
I'll continue this "review" on the 2nd season...

This anime is amazing, while terrible for some, including me. Two words, Love Triangle. If you hate love triangles, leave now while you still have a chance. If you ever find yourself stumbling on this show, you will have your heart ripped out, cut in to pieces, burned with hot sauce, lit on fire, and shoved up your ass. Stay away, seriously. However, if none of that turned you away, you are in for an amazing show.
The art style is great, leaving little to be desired. It almost never uses repeat animations, however, it makes use of comedic 'fancy backgrounds', which have nothing to dowith where the character is.


I'm not a professional, however, I would say the audio is well above average. The voice actors are great, and the music is good. There are plenty of sound effects, most of which are used to comedic effect.


The character development is great, having a deeper than normal backstory. There are few if any backstory scenes however. The characters start off simple, however, as the show continues, you constantly learn new things about them, as well as strengthen your understanding of them.


My overall enjoyment was shattered (refer to paragraph 1). I did not expect the love triangle to be very strong, however, as the story progressed, my enjoyment level crashed as well as hit an all time high. I am not sure how to describe this, as I hate love triangles. However, if I should say one thing, it is not a show you can stop watching easily.

Nisekoi's review for the whole anime Nisekoi is very good, in the story, the main character and other characters are also excellent,
for background story is also great because it is unusual or not found in other anime.
the story in this anime develops naturally until the last episode in season 1, for season 2 I think the story idea began to fade because the basic story from the beginning in the problem is not too important to discuss.
in this anime there is also a very good romantic story, because of the strong main character as its center and also other characters like classmates who have manyproblems that need to be solved.\n
it is becoming more interesting to watch as it raises a lot of curiosity about the next episodes.\n\n
so will there be Nisekoi season 3? . I think if it continues in the next season 3 maybe do not like in season 2, because the main problem is not a topic anymore and as if not discussed.\n

Nisekoi;False Love
Story: In all honestly. There are plenty of pros and cons about the story line. Truly, its a good thing though. The story is something that you don't see often. Yes you see a lot of anime with people having a childhood friend(s) and sometimes they dont remember them, or they fall in love with them. But, Nisekoi is a bit different. The story was given spunk and excitement to it. They made the childhood friend a total mystery, and keeps you guessing on who was the person Raku made the promise to. The story's suspense keeps on increasing more and more and keepsyou wondering where the romance and everything else is headed. I gave it an 8/10. Reason is, some certain things in the story get kinda cliche, but overall, they did a good job on making sure its something fresh. The episodes aren't rushed, they go at a smooth pace, and its easy to understand what going on. The plot keeps getting better and better and after reading the manga, for people who are watching the anime, get ready to be surprised. 


Art: I give the art 9/10 because honestly, if you pay attention to how the mouths move, or how all the background or foreground art is, even the characters and everything else itself, its really good. I love the way they have been drawn, the feeling is so HD like. Also looks well done. It might just be my opinion but, anime in 2013-2014 has really gotten so much better since better technology is here for people to draw with. I think that this anime was drawn extremely well though, even down to the littlest detail. I might be over exaggerating, but I just really like it. 


Sound: I really love the music in the anime, and I have to say my favorite is when whenever Raku and Chitoge are doing their little play when pretending to be dating, the music that comes on for those parts is perfect. It makes you laugh with the scene that just happened, and it gives a good feeling to it. The OP to the anime is amazingly done too. The art is fantastic, but the song is also very good. 


Character: The voices for each of the characters fits well in my opinion. In my head while reading the manga, I thought Raku's voice would be just a bit deeper, and same with Chitoge, but there voices are pretty damn close to what I would of thought. As for Kosaki, her voice is very girly, just what I would of thought. I think they did a good job. The characters themselves can be so funny, cute, serious, and great. I would have to say that their looks fit their personality great as well!


Enjoyment: I honestly love romance/comedy/highschool animes/mangas. I dont know why, but I do. This is one of my favorites by far. Its hard for an anime to get me attached to it, but this one did a great job. I just keep reading the manga until the next episode comes out, and I just read the most recent issue that came out. So yeah, Im pretty well hooked. This does a good job with making you want to know whats going on, who is Raku gonna end up with, where is the story gonna head to. Its weird, but addicting.


Overall. I seriously love this anime, I think a lot of people will like it once the story gets deeper. The beginning is sort of slow, but its still good. I wouldnt give it any higher than a nine.. for now. Although my review makes me seem just an obsessive person. Remember, although it has a lot of my opinions in it, and a lot of you wont agree, but I hope a lot of you will give it the chance, and hopefully some of you will like it as much as I do. The story is original, the characters are original, and it's funny, cute, and addicting. Now that I feel lame, I hope there will be next season of this anime..

I really wish 0.5 scores were a thing, then this could be at least a 6.5. Sadly, it's not.
Going over the rating criteria now based on season 1 of the anime ONLY --
Story:
The summary's premise makes this seem good. Then I checked it out and found out it's just another romance tale where the love interests pretty much get nowhere for the whole duration of the show for whatever contrived reason. I don't mind this so much if there's another, more otherworldly plot going on to sort of fill in for the slow romance advancement, but there isn't really. You're just left with the painfullyobvious conclusion by several episodes in who will be winning the love triangle. About 70% of the episodes in, they introduce a third love interest but let's be honest here, given the late introduction and the fact that one of the first two girls were already written to eventually win (probably with some time skip typical to purely romance plots in the manga), the third love interest served to do nothing more than pad the artificial tension with annoyingly clingy gimmicks.


Characters:

Given the way the main plot failed for this anime, the characters really would be the only thing that could still bump this anime's enjoyment up. Sadly, they failed. Kosaki is a stereotypical anime shy girl. Chitoge is effectively a classic tsundere with the belligerent sexual tension so belligerent that it fails to appeal. Kosaki's friend served as an annoyance to try to undo the painfully thick romance-plot armor of Chitoge. Marika is basically the trope that jumps in as an aggressive romantic rival doomed to fail by the makers of the show. The worst part is the fact that almost everyone involved in the promise ten years ago seems to have amnesia but there's no explanation for it. At least if all characters involved were blind as children or something, it would be easy to believe why all of them forgot what each other looked like. But no.


Art:

The best part of this show.


Sound:

Meh. Nothing special.


Enjoyment: 

Since there's no in-universe concerts or anything to enjoy, and the visuals are only good for it's genre but can't compare to more sleek titles like Fate Zero, there's really only the story and characters to consider for this show. And both of that is pretty mediocre. The overly frequent exaggerated faces of the cast made it harder to enjoy this show.


Who's this for:

-Shoujo fans (who haven't seen *gasp* Ouran, Maid-sama, etc)

-Slice of Life fans

-Someone looking for something reeeeeally light-hearted, not even trying to have the humor make sense 


Who's this not for:

-Someone who wants an epic or emotional story

-Someone who wants a work with unique concepts or at least rare romantic tropes

-Someone who wants something serious

So Nisekoi is a typical high harem rom com where a guy and a girl who don’t like each other have to pretend to be a couple for reasons beyond their control. Now I know there’s not a lot to expect from a show like this but it worked. The funniest moments were when Raku and Kirisaki answered honestly when they are suppose to be convincing others they’re a couple. Also I loathe unrequited love in anime (JUST TELL THEM HOW YOU FEEL!!!) but I liked how they put a tangible obstacle between Raku and Onodera. The characters are diverse and deep enough to bemore than just their primary archetype. The humor was well timed and relevant to the situations at hand. The background art was fantastic! Which I mention because most comedies skimp on the backgrounds. Even when the show is being ridiculous and over the top it doesn’t feel out of place given the improbable scenario. I enjoyed this series far more than I ever expected.\n

*This review contains no spoilers*
I have been putting off on this anime for years, and I finally got the time to cram all of the episodes. I have to say, this is a rather... unique anime. It is one of the better romance animes while still being unoriginal. It bears many resemblances to other anime but overall provides an enjoyable romantic comedy experience.
Story: 5
No doubt here that this is definitely the weakest point of this anime. The story uses many cliches, including:
-Childhood Promise
-Harem of girls
-The main girl being a blonde half-Japanese
-Shy girl in harem with a "partner" who pushes them into awkward situations
The list goeson and on... But somehow this anime manages to make these cliches into a uniquely enjoyable anime experience.


Art: 10


Not much to say here. The art looks beautiful, as expected from a modern anime from a relatively popular company. The art resembles a more rounded version of Bakemonogatari. In fact, much of the anime resembles Bakemonogatari in a way except for the story. The video cuts are similar to Bakemonogatari and the romances of the 2 main characters resemble each other. Still, it is a lovely art style that is to be expected. I have to admit, it was very heartwarming watching the emotional evolution of Chitoge and Raku.


Sound: 10


Very well designed soundtrack. if nothing else, this soundtrack is a very appealing one that shoudl nake any consider this anime as an option. The openings and endings are catchy (still resembling the style of Bakemonogatari), and the sad music really immerses you into this fictional world.


Characters: 9


The characters are well-designed, except for the fact that they aren't very unique. The characters still very much resemble the characters from Bakemonogatari (except for maybe one but revealing who that is would be a spoiler). In fact, the name Onodera Kosaki resembles a name from Bakemonogatari. The characters are funny, though, and they really do make this into an enjoyable experience. 


Enjoyment: 10


Definitely what pulls this anime through is its enjoyment. This is not much of an extreme ride, but it is very enjoyable, and the gradual realizations and relevations throughout the story make this one of the best and most suspenseful, but also one of teh most relaxing anime of the recent years.


Overall: 10


I would definitely recommend this anime to anyone looking for a good rom-com anime, or a good relaxing anime. I enjoyed it a lot.


(BTW would definitely recomment listening to CLICK and STEP by ClariS, as well as Recover Decoration by Kana Hanazawa, because they are really relaxing catchy songs that are fun to sing along to.)

Enjoyable, charming and very cute.
That's precise and short description of Nisekoi. I liked a lot of single details in this anime. Characters styling, scene timings, artwork, sound, story and more. Combination of these gives a great impression.
Nisekoi is a really sweet story. For me it's like a perfect rom com. Yeah it does have many clichés, but it never seems negative. I liked how they balance comedy and romance not sticking to any side too much. I think I could enjoy every single scene in this anime, nothing seemed out of a place.
Characters are super adorable. Change of their attitude is easily noticeable throughout theseries. It makes you empathize them.\n\n
Art is beautiful. Scenes are put at the right angles and distance. But great and realistic backgrounds are not a feature of this anime, yet it is not bad at all.\n\n
Sound. Great OP and ED. I'm so into Claris! Music is great too, gives the right atmosphere and feeling. Seiyuu are so fitting their characters, that's awesome!\n\n
Nisekoi is for you if you yearn for positive emotions without sad drama.

To begin this review I have to admit I have a bias toward the eye candy that shaft produces, and this review is spoiler free.
I personally view Nisekoi as a anime version of West side story or more specifically Romeo and Juliet and is an anime reminiscent of Toradora. Nisekoi is a very fun, light, and heartwarming anime that should he watched with this in mind, as the show verges off into a visual novel type of plot latet in the story, something I didn't really care for. Overall I'd say Nisekoi's strongest points are it's art style and character development around the 3 maincharacters, and aside from these two things the show doesn't really offer much else. The story leaves a bunch of plotholes laying around which aren't ever really answered and the ending was one of those ending that allows for a second season but as a result is rather unsatisfying. \n\n
However despite the shows flaws the show had me completely enticed with it from the first 5 minutes and had me smiling or laughing the entire time. this show is definetly something you should give a shot and is one of my personal favorite slice of lives.

Nisekoi anime was created by SHAFT.  Nisekoi is an adaptation of the manga with the same name, the series is still on-going, and I already caught up to date with the recent chapter.  I been pump for the anime to come out when they announced it, because I love Nisekoi One-shot, and I think the first part of the manga series was decent, until the introduced harem into the series.  So no matter, I'm going to watch it.  There are 20 episode in the anime.  And 1 OVA releasing soon.  This is a full review of the 20-episode.
Story: 7
Nothingmagnificent about the story, a lot of cliche and Rom-Com aspect.  The story so far is Raku Ichijou(MC), a son of a Yakuza faction, made a promise the girl that he can't remember her face, but he remember the promise, and if they reunited they get married; all the got out of it was the locket the girl gave him and the promise.  Fast forward to future, Raku is now in High school, and he still think about the promise.  When a transfer student named Chitoge Kirisaki, knee him in the face by accident; both of them are forced the find the locket, and they stared to hate each other when they are finding the locket, they did find the locket btw.  After Raku return home, he is found out that there was war between Yakuza faction and the beehive.  To end the war Raku and the Beehive daughter must date for three years.  The Beehive daughter is none of other than Chitoge Kirisaki.  The story is somewhat similar to Love Hina.  I think the story was okay in Nisekoi, but I like the story for the one-shot better than the manga series, because Manga series introduce annoying harem and character.


Art: 9

The art is was great in the anime.  SHAFT know how to make good animation.  SHAFT is know to for series like Monogatari and Puella Magi Madoka Magica.  But it nothing special about it; it not like Shaft is like Kyoto Animation.


Sound: 7

ClariS, the singers behind Oriemo, made to Opening music for Nisekoi.  I will admit I like the Opening Music because I like ClariS, and Ending music is pretty decent.  The voice actor are good at what they do.  Nothing impressive of the sound.  Sound usual to me.


Character: 8

Nothing special about the character.  Mostly the same as every harem anime out there.  There character, most all, are childhood friend(We found out later in the anime).   Raku Ichijou just an average character, he is like an average male manga harem character.  There are three main girl - Chitoge, Onodera, and Marika.  Chitoge is daughter of the Beehive leader and Raku fake girlfriend, who happen to be a tsundere.  Onodera, she is Raku crush, and she happen to like him back, but both is too afraid to confess to each other, she is worst part of the anime.  Marika, she is the police chief daughter, and she obsessed with Raku, and she is his fiancee by Police chief and Raku father(who he forgotten about).  The minor character are Tsugumi, she is Chitoge friend, and she is working for the Beehive to protect Chitoge, and also a tsundere.  Shuu, Raku best friend.  Ruri, Onodera best friend, she tried to get Onodera to confess to Raku.  The worst part of this anime is the harem aspect and annoying character.


Enjoyment: 8

Although I know what going happen in the series; I did enjoy some part to the anime, mostly the Chitoge and Raku parts.  I like the opening and ending music.


Overall: 8

The anime wasn't godly or anything.  It was an average anime show, that people will enjoy...maybe, if you are into Rom-Com harem with little mystery.  The worst part of the anime is the harem and the annoying character.

If you have ever wondered what it feels like a harem king in your life, this is the anime will show you. The story is very likeable to some people while others will bash for it. The characters are well developed. In terms of romance, well you have to decide which team will you bet till the end of the story. No ecchi, no sexual jokes  little fanservice perfect for watching while the door is unlocked. The comedy is hilarious and intense (watch this to get the meaning of intense).
The author did a marvelous job in making this funny story. Seriously, been laughing sohard from beginning to end ( I finished the manga a while back). The best anime harem genre today for me. It is included in my top 10 favorite series of all time.


Season 3 pls come soon. I know who won the heart of the boy protagonist so read the manga ASAP after you finished both seasons. 


#TeamKosakiOnodera

I know many love this anime , so I watched it suspecting it to be amazing I was disappointed  
I'm gonna start with the things I liked , The relationship between Chitoge and Raku was very interesting and fun to watch  . I wish the should have  anime focused more over their relationship than shoving more not needed characters to the mix . One of the only reasons I kept watching was because of this spice that was Raku and Chitoge had . 
Now I have many issues with the show , the biggest issue was how the show shoved not neededcharacters . The show could be so much better if it focused on Raku , Chitoge and Onodera . \n
I feel the show would be better as a love triangle than a harrem , because tsugumi and tachibana were just side characters with no purpose . Another thing I didn't like was how two characters are having a emotional and serious conversation and suddenly a character pops up and ruins the whole moment . Another thing is how an episode is dedicated to two characters and then suddenly at the very last few minutes of the episode gets focused on another character like the built up of the two characters was nothing . I get that this is a harem but a good harem needs to balance its emotions and time for the characters so in the end its gets harder to chose who ends up with who , but just shaving characters like that is just not natural and is just distasteful .My last issue is how raku reacts to everything , sometimes he acts like a straight up jerk and behaves like he doesn't care at all . \n
This show has been in my watch list for awhile and watching it now , I'm disappointed . \n\n\n
I don't recommend this anime but if you like it go ahead and I'm not hating on anyone who likes the show .There was potential but it was thrown out the window .
